The whole experience was very discouraging and it's not even busy. Would never come back.
author: Trang D.

description:
Not even one star!!Never going to come back.

I wrote review on last Saturday and i was lil tired of this restaurant,cuz they sent me a message what was wrong and I replied you'll find out.And I received E mail from yelp,they determined  my review cuz It fails their guideline.
Maybe they need more detail.So Im writing what happened.
I ordered 2shaved ice to go on the phone and the guy said it will be ready in 20min.

So I came to pick them up 20 min later.it's not ready to pick up.They didn't even seem busy at all.

Anyways that could happen,So Me and my BF sat in front of restaurant and waited.Last time same thing was happened,the waiter didn't allow me to sit in the bar,He wanted me to sat outside.So at this time,I sat in front of Arang Restaurant (the hallway)and WAITED another 20min.that wasn't nice,if they're really busy and if when I called they said oh,it'll ready in 40min,I would wait!!
We all wait for the pizza delivery average 40min,right??
And then what happened?nobody even said sorry,and I asked to waiter onetime while I was waiting when it's going to be ready,He didn't even respond.
Hopefully no message at this time,no determination,now you know why I invested my time to writing this review,if you guys really care about your business you should improve your service.
author: Katelyn L.

description:
My friends and I went during J-Pop Summit and everything in Japantown was packed and had over an hour long wait at a minimum with the Ramen Street, food trucks, and actual restaurants. One of our friends used to live in Filmore, they knew what restaurants were actually good. Considering how packed everything was, having a server say that the wait was only 30 minutes was great.

In the end, the three of us waited for about 45 minutes and there's the place is super small so I'm okay with the wait. However, things from there went downhill. First of all, the service there was horrible. We barely has our server come by wnough to get her attention that we were ready to order. Plus, the table wasn't properly cleaned so sauce dripped onto my friend's jeans. Then we had to move tables because apparently the servers cannot figure out how six people can be seated at a table of four.

Now onto the food itself. How come there was no banchan? I've never gone to one Korean restuarant and had no banchan. I've lways at least had 2 banchan served before my meal and this place is not one of those fusion places where you could look over it. Plus, there was no red chili paste to put with my food. Considering how they didn't really season my food, they should have offered that. The wait for our food was short, but that probably had to do with the quality of the food. I got dol sot bibimbap. The stone could have been hotter since my rice didn't get crispy towards the end. The egg was at the right consistency and they put all the usual vegetables. It was an okay dol sot bibimbap, but nothing that would draw be back to going there.

For the price I paid, I was expected a little more for my buck since I've paid the same amount for the same thing in San Jose. Considering this is SF, I expected better Korean food especially since it is super close to Japantown and there is some good Korean food in the area.
author: Isabel C.

description:
Quick, easy and friendly service for lunch. 
No real stand outs but consistent quality.
author: Lhm M.

description:
this place is awesome. great food. excellent service. if you tell them (as I must) that you don't know Korean food they'll tell you flat out what's good and what's better. 

every time I've been here it's been great. 

one final word for you. with much hot sauce:

bibimbap
author: Steve F.

description: Good for bento boxes and cheap Korean food eats! They even have their own version of pat bing soo (korean shaved ice).
author: Kristen C.

description:
I think maybe management has changed? Im not sure.

Ive dined here a few times now and it used to be my go-to spot for korean food in SF.

This last time I really didnt care much for the food.

Unfortunately I don't think I will be back.
author: Anne-Mary P.

description:
This place has fed me well during my days living across the street at The Fillmore Center. I still come around here for lunch breaks and rare occasions for late-night sober eats. (Yes, it's possible that pure, non-alcoholic-induced cravings can hit at 11 at night).

This is a rather small place with a simple lay out. Not much to look at on the outside, and inside are about 10 or so tables + a counter. Food generally takes about 10-15 minutes and they get it right every time. Staff are attentive and courteous, and leave you undisturbed while you enjoy your meal.

(+):
-Open from 11a-2am. 
-Offers an extensive drink/food menu. Faves are soondubu, dol sot or seafood bibimbap, and the bento boxes.
-Good for a quick and satisfying meal.

(-):
-Small selection of ban chan (side dishes)
-Tables are super close together, a little too intimate for me. One time this guy was spilling his problems to the girl he was with, that was pretty darn annoying and unpleasant. Really tried hard to not cut this guy down to size and tell him to "man the $%#! up and get over it."

Overall: A quick, in and out kind of place for Korean food. Dishes are about $8-14, decent for both lunch and dinner options.
author: Loriel L.

description: We came here on a Thanksgiving day. I liked the tea and beer OB here. All the foods we ordered were excellent and on time. We ordered some soup, bulgogi plates, chicken teriyaki. I can recommend this place!
author: Muhiddin K.

description:
Decent Korean food at a good price, but as much as I'd love to recommend this place, the service is pretty bad. It's unacceptable to get the bill only after waiting for 15min for a server to stop by my table, giving up, and asking for my bill when there were only one or two other tables occupied at the time.

Short version:
Food - Decent
Price - Good
Service - What service?
author: Patrick L.

description: A favorite spot to go for Korean food.  I mainly like the restaurant because they are one of the rarer places that still use pork (rather than beef) in their kimchee soup.
author: S S.

description:
First of all don't ever give me Korean food to go with out kimchee,2nd the tea was cold and not very good. What was Korean about it it???? It tasted like bad Japanese food, i get better Gyoza at Trader Joe's.

These other reviewers must be hanging out with some urban farmers before they eat 
here. Cause I guess anything will take have ass good after that.

They was one plus they give you chopsticks
author: Kim R.

description: Ummm..what happened?? This was one of my favorite Korean places in SF until this past weekend. I ordered my usual beef bi bom bop, I looked at it and thought, um did they forget to give me rice, it looks so little compared to before. The bowl is usually filled to the top, this was barely half full. Then I ate it and it lacked in flavor, the bottom wasn't even crispy from the stone pot. We got a tofu, clam, kimchee soup which I was really looking for to. PROBLEMS when it's watered down to the point of we needed to add salt to it! That is just unheard of, adding salt to Korean food that's usually super flavorful, BIG Problem!..Sigh..I wonder if they changed owners or cook. No bueno.
author: Karen T.

description: Came here for a quick takeout order to order Duk Gook for my boyfriend since he wasn't feeling anything too spicy. The order was pretty large, and tasty. I ordered the kimchee fried rice to-go and it was a bit spicy, but not bad. I was only disappointed in the portion of the rice though.
author: Amanda C.

description:
After a quick look around the area we found this small Korean restaurant in the corner and decided to give it a try. 

Arang is a quite small place with quick service. We were seated immediately and ordered a tofu soup for me and a bibimbap for my boyfriend. Usually at Korean places you are served banchan, the side dishes of kimchi, soybeans, cucumbers etc before the actual meal comes but at this restaurant we didn't receive our banchan tray until the main meal arrived which was kind of strange. 

The tofu soup was just okay, not anything stellar but it had A LOT of tofu in it. It was difficult to find anything else in the soup (aka meat) since everything was tofu lol The broth was a bit spicy but tasted good and they give you a side of rice. I still think it was overpriced for what it was though. The bf thought the bibimbap was pretty good but not anything overwhelmingly awesome. In the end our stomachs were satisfied but I'm not going to make this my go-to Korean spot anytime soon.
author: Sam F.

description:
Overall unimpressed with the food.  The salad and BBQ beef were both lacking in flavor.  I also ordered a squid skewer appetizer, which may have been the most overcooked squid I've ever had in my life.  If my food didn't arrive quickly I would have guessed that the chef stopped for a nap after putting the squid on the grill.

If I wanted to eat ocean leather I would have just dipped my shoe in the bay and had a go at that.
author: Taylor W.

description: I ordered a wonton soup. It was very nice. I really like the beef int the soup. It's tender but not tasteless.
author: DimSumLover S.

description: Was craving for Korean food when I was in the area. Came to Arang and got their short rib box. The ribs were pretty good with a lot of flavoring. The box also came with clear noodles, gyoza, salad, and rice. Arang is not a bad place to eat and is easy on the wallet. Service was okay for the day I came. Would return when I am in the area.
author: Peter C.

description:
I'll admit it.  When it comes to dining out, I'm lazy.  So when going out for Korean, I'm not a huge fan of those "grill it yourself" KBBQ joints.  Fortunately, Arang does all the grillin' in back so that you can sit back and enjoy your meal and company.

I've been to Arang several times.  The menu features your typical Korean dishes...Bi Bim Bop (stone pot rice), Bulgogi (marinated beef), Galbi (marinated beef short ribs), and even other non-Korean items like Tempura.  And of course, your meal is complemented with Banchan (Korean side dishes)

But what you NEED to order is the meat casserole!  Everytime I'm feeling a little down, this pot of goodness provides me with a quick pick-me-up.  They bring out a propane burner and a pot full of deliciousness.  Think kim-chee tofu soup.  But instead of kim-chee and tofu, the caserole contains slices of spam and hot dogs (sounds random...but I promise it's delicious), ramen noodles, and rice cakes.  Scoop over a side of rice and you're good to go!

This is seriously Korean comfort food!
author: Matt S.

description: Short ribs tasted really good! And plus the Kalbi tang was delicious.
author: Suwito S.

description:
I've been here a bunch of times a couple of years ago and remember that the food was delicious. However, I came back recently and was disappointed. 

The banchans were terrible. The kimchi tasted like it was made the night before and had zero time to ferment. 

I got the beef plate and my beef was sweeter than a cupcake. Okay, maybe not like a cupcake but it tasted like someone tossed in 3 tablespoons of sugar into my beef. My friends got the combo dishes with similar beef. Theirs were also sweet but not on the same level as mine. Perhaps it was a fluke but that left a negative impression on me.
author: LeTran B.

description: Very good beef bento box. Love the vermicelli it comes with. Service very nice and fast. Brown rice tea yummy too.
author: Robert M.

description:
Good portions and great taste, especially by NorCal Korean food standards.  My friend seems to think they've changed owners or chefs.  I'm inclined to agree since recent visits seem to have tasted better, a jump from four to five stars.

Get:

Man doo gook
Kalbi
Hae mul pa jeon
Bi bim bap
Ox tail noodle soup

Can't go wrong with any of the above. I can't handle spicy dishes, which would explain my choices. Their soju concoctions are good too, but I'd stick with the yogurt soju combo. 

Small restaurant though, so reserve or come early.
author: Erika C.

description:
Ever since we moved to San Francisco 3 years ago, we have been searching for a good Korean restaurant.  We find this restaurant to be the best so far.

I enjoy the short rib soup and found the one served in this restaurant very good.  The soup was rich and the beef was tender.  The gul bugi here is flavorful and tender.  We enjoyed our lunch tremendously and will be returning.
author: Robert W.

description:
I was tempted to give Arang 5 Stars because of the memories I have here, but definitely 4 Stars because of the food.

The staff here are always friendly, quick and attentive.  I'm a sucker for Korean food and have visited numerous Korean restaurants around the city.  Each booth here sets an intimate ambiance where you and your friends can catch up, have caual conversation and enjoy good food.

The side dishes are always good.  Sometimes I have no idea what I'm eatting, but it's awesome!  Pickles radishes, Kim Chi, Sardines, veggies, egg pancakes, kumandu, you name it, it's on the menu.

From the bulgogi to the clay pots, you'll always have the home cooked meal that's filling and satisfying.  I'm not picky when I go here, my friends and I order family style and everything is good, I mean it, literally everything.

Arang you ARE the Business!
author: Edrian D.

description:
Small little place, but quite busy for lunch

- BBQ beef lunch combo
   - Beef is below average
- Salmon Terriyaki lunch combo
    - Salmon is alright but nothing special

Service is very slow...
author: Coco L.

description:
3.5 stars. Although this isn't the best Korean food, this place is reliable, convenient, and consistent. Boyfriend and I come here a lot to get our Korean fix. He (who is Korean) is always trying to have me try different dishes, which I have tried a lot, but I still always turn to my soon dobu.

Soon Dobu is good here, but some of the other items I've tried are just okay. I do like their ban chan here - only a few selections but they're always tasty and I like how they present it on one plate with separate compartments. Easier to move around/refill and less clutter. 

Just like another Yelper mentioned, the tea here is yummy! One of my favorite teas at a Korean restaurant.

Service is okay here - usually sort of aloof and they don't talk to you much. But overall, this is one of the spots I do like getting my fix. Open late and easy to park!
author: Tiffany K.

description: Just ate there yesterday afternoon, and got diarrhea during the night. The place was full of flies, so I guess it shouldn't come as a surprise. Do yourself a favor and stay out of this place.
author: Dan P.

description: what can i say about Arang is that its my go to for Korean food in particular dolsot bibimbap the food is great the portions enormous and they are very accommodating i don't eat beef but was able to substitute tofu with no problems good service all around plus the prices are good highly recommended :)
author: rochi c.

description: Go-to place for late-night Korean food (they close at 2am). It's reasonable, fast, & there are many options of the menu. The bibimbop, tofu soup, and kalbi soup all good. And I love the traditional sides that come with it too!
author: Alysha K.

description:
I've been here many times and I must say it's a pretty good place for the amount you pay. If you go there during lunch time, you can get a really good deal, too!

I've tried:
*Bi-Bim-Bap ($8.95): Comes with assorted small Korean dishes
*Marinated Rice Sticks ($6.95): Spicy but I can't stop eating them!
*Bi-Bim-Neng-Myon ($7.95): I used to only know Bi-Bim-Bap but then I discovered this chewy cold noodle dish. It has been my favorite ever since!

I would also recommend their lunch boxes. They are filling but also cheap! 

I think every waiter or waitress who works here are nice. I've never had any bad service experience.

In my opinion, this is a perfect lunch spot! Yes, of course I will go back for more!
author: Alice L.

description:
Waitress: "Can I see your IDs please?"

My friends and I *eyebrows raised*: "We're old..."

Waitress: "You guys look YOUNG!"

Me (thinking to myself): "YAY! Maybe I DO have a couple of years before I officially become 'Cougar Status'!"

Last night's dinner at Arang was like a trip down memory lane for me. In the early 2000s, this was the "spot" to come for underage drinking before/after karaoke. Past forward 10 years, it's good to know that they NOW check IDs b/c I absolutely do NOT condone underage drinking *eyes staring at the ceiling*. 

My friends and I came to here at about 9:30 PM for a post-movie dinner/drinking. A table of four had just left, so we were promptly seated.

FOOD/DRINKS:
*Peach Soju (Pitcher - $24): It was ok. We used this to chase down the Chamisul.  The peach taste came from peach syrup from a can and not juice as it was a bit syrupy, sweet, and an odd yellow/orange color. If you like fruit sojus made w/ real fruit juice, check out the "The Spot" or "Toyose" in the Sunset. 

*Yogurt Soju (Small - $6): Better than the peach soju. It was creamy, sweet, and tart with a slight hint of alki flavor. 

*Chamisul (375 ml - $9.95): It was GOOD! The filtered sake was clean and refreshing. 

*Soondubuchigae (Tofu Soup - $8.95): I didn't have any, so I can't account for the taste.

*Tteokbokki (Korean Rice Sticks -$9.95): Meh! The cylinder rice sticks were boiled and then stir-fried in gochujang (chili and fermented soybean) sauce. Because the rice sticks are very glutinous and wasn't cooked thoroughly, it was like chewing on stale gum. 

*Kalbi (BBQ Beef Shortribs - $16.95): YUMMY! The short ribs were perfectly cooked and were fatty, tender, and very flavorful from the soy, ginger, garlic, brown sugar, and sesame marinade. 

*Stir-fried Soon-dae (Korean Sausage - $12.95): Eck! This looked nothing as pictured on the menu nor on Yelp which displayed slices of fried sausages. What we received was sausages mixed with jap chae (vermicilli) and gochujang. Soon-dae is made of pig's intestines and stuffed with a mixture of pig's blood, rice, green onions, garlic, minced pork, and vermicelli. It's definitely an acquired taste. Because it's steamed first, it's has a mushy texture and an irony after taste. The jap chae was overcooked and soaking in the gochujang sauce. 

*Spam and Sausage Jeongol (Casserole - $22.95): YUMMY! Essentially, you get a big pot of kimchee soup filled with sliced rice cakes, kimchee, SPAM, hotdogs (not the soon-dae), green onions, topped with a block of raw ramen. After letting everything simmer on your table for 5 minutes, mix everything and you have a stew-like concoction. If you like kimchee tofu soup, ramen, and most importantly SPAM, you will LOVE this dish! The soup was rich, savory, and super spicy. And, the other ingredients depend on the cooking time, cook it shorter if you want al-dene ramen and rice cakes and longer if not. 

*Kimchee Fried Rice ($7.95): YUMMY! Spicy al-dente rice w/ cubes of spam and an egg over easy with a runny yolk....may I need to say more? I don't think so...

*Bingsu (Korean Shaved Ice - $4.95): YUMMY! The shaved ice is topped with vanilla ice cream, red beans, bananas AND cinnamon toast crunch! It's basically a Korean version of Halo-halo. It's had a good combo of texture combos: cold, creamy, rich, sweet, and crunchy. This is a definite MUST order to cool down your tongue after devouring all the spicy dishes!

SERVICE: 
For an Asian restaurant, I thought it was pretty damn good. The waitress was very nice and friendly. She took our orders promptly, we got ALL of our food within 15 minutes, and she came to check on us every so often.

AMBIANCE/DÉCOR:
Hasn't changed a bit from the last time I went in 2001. They still have the same neon sign inside and out, bamboo plants, and hanging bubble lights. The dining area to the left has 4 tables that sits 4 people each and there's 3-4 booths on the right side that sits 4 people each. 

PARKING:
Arang is conveniently located in The Fillmore Shopping Plaza (Safeway, Popeyes) across from Panda Express and next to Subway, so you can park in the lot. 

Although some of their items were a Hit OR Miss, Arang's pricing and service has an edge over other Korean restaurant; e.g. Won Mi charges $25.95 for Kalbi while Arang charges just $16.95. So, if you're having a late night craving for Korean Food (closes at 2 AM everyday) and don't feel like dropping $$$, Arang is definitely a place to check out esp for their bento boxes under $10 which comes with a meat of your choice, jap chae, gyoza, rice, and salad!
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
I have been here several times and I agree, the service here is either a hit or a miss, came here with my son and needed a high chair bit they say they only got one...need to wait for the next table to finish in order to get it. Fine I waited and waited and waited until that table to leave and yes,, they forgot about my request. 

OK lets talk about the food

They are so Stingy with the side dishes. Their price is no where cheaper than others but their side dishes are so small.....I asked them for more and seemed that they didn't want to give me extra tho.

The tofu soup was okay. I prefer my tofu house more tho.

The beef dish we order on a sizzling plate was dry and not much of taste.

Anyways I still give three stars because I did had better experience in the paSt but don't the8no I wanna be back anytime soon.
author: Constance H.

description:
Food was flavorful but disappointing.  We had the dol sot bi bim bap.  We also had the seafood and kim chee varieties.  All of them had the same problem.  There wasn't any of that crispy, crunchy goodness from the stone pot.  Not sure if they under cooked the rice, if the pot wasn't hot enough, or they didn't coat the pot with enough sesame oil, but it isn't really dol sot bi bim bap with out that crunchiness right?

The service was also pretty bad.   They were friendly enough when they sat you, but after that we didn't see them unless we flagged them down, which we had to do several times.  Maybe they are used to the late night crowd that just hangs out for hours, but we were there pretty early and everyone needs their tea refilled once in a while.
author: Ramil C.

description:
There's usually cute Korean chicks eating here...  and cute Chinese chicks...  I like asian chicks.  
Oh... and tonight we ordered the spicy wings... but we got the spicy sauce on the side.  
That's gonna be my new shit.
Watch...  You heard it  here first!  Deep fried loveliness, then a bowl of  "dunk it like you want it" red, sweet, spicy, savory, sweaty-forehead sauciness all over your everything.
It's better this way.  Why?  Hmmm... more interactive I suppose?  More fun?  Especially when you double-dip bone-showing, bit-into, gastric goodness with a few of your favorite Hite and Soju infused brothers and sisters!  
Gun Bae~!
author: Barry A.

description: I loooove the soups here. I have been coming here for about 5 years now. Great place to cure a hang over, or just fill your belly with something tasty. Open real late so that is a MAJOR plus. :D
author: Wilde E.

description: That Bi Bim Bap hot stone dish never fails. This pokey little place was somewhat hard to find but when we did, we were greeted with excellent service, delicious food and rice tea. This was my first rice tea experience and it was something I will order again and again.I can't get over the prices either. This tucked away gem is worth your time!
author: Nadine R.

description:
It is not The Tofu House and the banchan also isn't all that extensive. The lunch specials however cannot be beat. Once again, it is not The Tofu House; but it $8.99 for bi bim bap  or their soon tofu soup. Price wise it's pretty awesome. 

I never go during busy hours, so I've lucked out on great service all the time. It's not the best Korean food, but if you live close by and craving korean; this is the spot.
author: Nancy V.

description:
Had my usual "let's play catchup" with my friend (picked her up from work) and I told her I was craving for Korean food with TV so I could watch the NBA Finals. She denied the TV request but did take me here for the other request of "no I don't feel like cooking my food and a cheap spot."

Bingo.

We parked at the Safeway lot (probably the unsafest Safeway I've been too since my Hayward days!)

We got seated right away since there wasn't much folks inside and it was early. 

Friend ordered the grilled beef box (it came with noodles + gyoza + salad and I forget the rest) and I ordered the grilled short ribs plate (since I was really hungry and needed protein...)

We also shared soju (yellow kind) and off we went with our gossip time.

Food came out pretty quickly. Friend finished her food (just the right amount for her) and my grilled short ribs was good and it satisfied the craving. Meat quality wasn't the best and it wasn't really grilled up to my taste... 

Service was friendly and fast. Will probably go back if I have another "must have Korean food" moments but perhaps I should ask myself to reevaluate how much do I really want Korean food over my life!
author: Cath M.

description: Arang is my favorite lunch time place. They're always quick and friendly. Food is great and well priced. They also supported our business when it opened two weeks ago. Thanks Arang!
author: Rodney D.

description: Good value for what you get.. I like to get the kal bi dinner which comes with a lot of stuff... (vermicelli, rice, gyoza, salad.. etc)... and they give you a good amount of meat.. their other items like the ramen the pot thing is really good... and seafood pancake is yummy. Oh! and their soju is good too! The place is pretty small.. so expect a wait sometimes...
author: Tiff C.

description: I met these friends here after hanging out at Encore on 5-29-14 1:45am'sh.  They ordered the marinated pork, soondubu soup and rice along with the side dishes.  The service was attentive.  When I asked the waiter for the bill, the female already paid for it---this is very rare and hardly even know her, so it was cool.
author: Jer W.

description: Food was really good. Good portion, cheap price, tastes good. Lunch and dinner boxes were great as well as the tofu soup and kimchi. Very polite staff, Thank you!
author: Boji I.

description:
Was going between a 3 or 4 star, but decided on 4 because of the other Korean food in the area. This is one of the better places to get bibimbap. The sides were a little meh. Service was good. Kimchi was actually a good spice. Music was fun. 

A hidden little place kinda next to Subway. Glad we were directed there by a Korean friend of ours.
author: Kat M.

description:
I've been here three times so far and very satisfied with the quick service and good food. I'm a Korean food fanatic, so this place always hits the spot. This isn't the most up to date décor restaurant in the area...but if you enjoy Korean food, you won't care!
Even better, there is a Korean store across the street if you want to make bulgogi at home.
author: Quinn S.

description: I've been here a few times and the food is pretty good. Parking is easy as you can use the lot by the Safeway. The restaurant is really small and can only accommodate about ten couples. This makes me wonder, why is the service so slow and uninterested?? My service was really bad this last time, enough so that I now will not come back after having eaten here maybe five times.
author: Robert H.

description:
I loved this place when I ate there a few years ago. Lunch was large and cheap. Just how I like it. The bar-be-que beef was great and came with all sorts of side dishes. 

The place is tiny so there was a few minute wait but the food was well worth it. I'll return.
author: Justin C.

description:
I stopped by this place for some late night Soft Tofu Soup (Soon Dobu Jigae). Being a big fan of Soft Tofu Soup in general, I have to say that the one here is actually pretty good. They also serve you a whole bunch (maybe 10?) of those small appetizers with your meal.

The place has a typical Korean decor, and it's nice to watch the K-Pop music videos on the main TV while enjoying your Korean food. 

One of the best thing about this place is that it's open late, so you can stuff yourself with some tasty Korean food after some light drinking. No complaints with respect to the staff. This place is a little pricier than usual though.
author: Don L.

description:
One of the worst places I have ever been at went there for the first time and ordered a chicken noodle soup and I told them I can't eat anything spicy cause of medical problem they said ok.
They brought out the soup and when I put the spoon in I saw there was two very long strains of hair in it I called the waitress over to show her and she acted as if it was not a big deal she took it away and 20min later brought me another one and when I looked at it they had put all kinds of spicy peppers after telling them I could not eat spicy food so I got up and told the lady and told her I was just Going to go but she insisted I pay for the food even tho I did not touch neither of the soups bottom line the place is not clean at all it does not have customer service at all first and last time ill ever go there
author: Jonathan M.

description:
I have been here about 3 times since I moved to the area. They have good short ribs and the spicy soft tofu soup is decent.
My only complaint is the service. They seem to only have 1 waiter, and he's pretty careless. I finished my lukewarm tea by the time he brought our side dishes,  so I asked him for more tea.
He said, OK, and seemed like he was going to go get it, but then he didn't. I saw him on the other side of the counter just standing around looking unsure of himself, and then eventually he brought us our dinner orders, but still no tea. So, I had to ask again.
He finally brought me another cup of tea, and it still wasn't even hot. Then we had to chase him down once we finished eating to get the check. And I mean we literally had to get up and find him because he was nowhere to be seen.

90% of what I eat is asian food so I'm used to bad service but it is tiring sometimes to have to run after a waiter when there are only 3 other tables for him to wait on lol.

Overall, food is good, service sucks. Good place to go when it's late at night and you're craving korean food.
author: Hilarie L.

description:
Kalbi
Bulgogi
Sondopu
Peach, Yogurt or Lemon Soju Cocktails
Bi bim bap
Bindaeddeok
Dukbokki 

And..the list goes on! 

Came here for a late dinner with a friend after lion dance practice. We were looking to go to Jtown for food, but the parking sucked so we parked in the plaza with a Safeway in it and walked on over. 

The service was quick and we were seated in less than a minute. For a Friday night, this place was packed with people and you could hear the latest kpop music in the background. I'd recommend this place for couples and for small groups of friends. Having a large group here, you may just take up the whole restaurant. 

Alright, the food. My friend ordered the Chicken galbi bento box and I had the Bulgogi box. It came with a decent amount of lettuce with thousand island dressing, two pieces of gyoza, a small mound of japchae (silver noodles marinated in sesame sauce) and fermented potatoes. It was enough to fill us up while we were there. 

From the time we sat down to the time we left, the staff refilled our tea when it went down to half full. Unfortunately, we didn't order any alcohol that night. Observing some of the other tables, it looks like the lemon or yogurt soju were the most popular. As we were leaving, these two guys ordered a few pitchers of it. That will be something I will try next time! 

The only thing that I am giving one less star on is for the tea. Barley tea with toasted rice krispies tastes alright, but it tasted like there was some dish soap in it. My friend noticed it too, but its not that important. As long as I don't get sick from eating Korean food, I'm a happy camper. 

Kamsahamnida Arang!
author: Jason C. J.

description:
my bf is HOOOKED on the bi bim neng myon here. We've been here almost every week and he always gets that.

the dubokki is yummy and spicy and sweet and really soft and chewy. we also tried their stone pot bulgogi which totally reminds me of when i was in korea. 

also tried the kimchee fried rice which was good. i think we'll eventually try everything on the menu. great for 4 or less people cuz its such a small place.

we'll be back on monday!
author: Christine M.

description: OH how I've missed you so much Arang Restaurant!  Ok...so sure it's not THE best place for Korean food..but when you're hungry at 1am and you don't want fast food - THIS is the happenin' place.  You've GOT to try this place out!  They have your usual late night korean food from dduk bokki, bi bim bop, paejeon and various soups.  They even have good peach soju if you're looking to have a few drinks.  The place is not very big so you might have to wait for a table, but it's definitely worth waiting.  Very few times have I decided to go to Mel's Diner or one of those other small places around the city, but when I'm closeby Arang, I definitely have to make a stop even if I'm not that hungry.  I just like the cozy feeling of the restaurant and sharing a plate full of dduk bokki with friends~ it reminds me of the good ol' days in college :)
author: Grace K.

description: Food was ok, probably authentic Korean.  Place is dirty, there was something in my water, and a few flies. Won't be going back at all.
author: Mark A.

description:
Poor customer service.
I went in with a group of 4, the waitress told me that she is cleaning up the table and that it would be a 5 minute wait.
We wait about 5 and a group of korean girls walk also with the same number of guests and they seat them before me.
How rude!
Needless to say, I was gone after that.
author: Teresa C.

description:
FOOD & DRINK:
1.) House tea = Holy cow their tea is good! ;) yummy love the rice or whatever it is in it.
2.) Dol Sot BiBimBap = mm! but with Shitake mushrooms. (Shitake mushrooms personally leave a weird aftertaste for me) But this was completely satisfying my bibimbap craving
3.) Kim Chee Tofu Soup = More sour


SERVICE:
Not bad.


ATMOSPHERE:
Such a hidden little korean spot! Like a secret door in the corner of the plaza on Fillmore/Safeway. It's chill though, very casual.

10.9
author: Angela L.

description: This was the first time I went to this restaurant and it will be the last. I ordered one of the lunch boxes- the combination. After 20 min of waiting and seeing two other tables receive their food even though the customers ordered after me. I was told that the combination plate took longer. That is patently ridiculous since it includes the same food as the other items in the menu. I did receive the food 5 min later. It was cold ( the "hot"food) and the tempora was also soggy. The waitress was totally unfriendly and I sure didn't feel welcome there. Nearly all the other patrons were Asian. Perhaps that's what they want. Very disappointing . Avoid this place- especially if you are not Asian
author: Frank S.

description:
I'm looking at my December 2011 receipts and I ate here not long ago.
We ordered the Bi Bim Bap, Galbi, Spicy Tofu Soup, and the Kimchee Fried Rice. It was a lot of food, so we took our time cramming it down. It's a smallish place fyi. The food is really satisfying. I like the fact that the "scenery" was giving my eyes a work-out; I couldn't be too obvious though. Big points for being opened until 2am. My goal is to try most things on their menu.
author: Derek N.

description:
I usually don't yelp anything, but because I've been here so many times, I figured why not? 

I love this place! I honestly can't seem to find the assorted meat combo at any other Korean restaurant. That is my absolute favorite dish and the marinated rice stick with ramen noodles too. It's a small place, but the wait is never too long. The customer service is very friendly and the food comes out fairly quickly. Definitely a place where you can grab delicious Korean food in the middle of the night because it closes so late. Highly recommended!
author: Tina N.

description: I've been coming Arang for more than 15 yrs and same awsom tastes as of today.  I like their kim chi fried rice and hamburger steak, they go pretty well together.  Seafood hot pot soup is my another favorite menu. There're lots mixed fresh seafood like shrimps, mussels, calamari, crabs, etc......and spicy!  I recommend for all soju lovers MUST order it.
author: Mi H.

description: This place has definitely changed.  The quality and portion of their dishes have gone way down hill. I know they have changed management a few years back but c'mon, don't you see people complaining about your food an earshot away? I came here with my family before they changed hands and their food kept me coming back. I 've always ordered their combo box with beef and tempura and let me tell you, their beef was perfectly marinated and very edible. Now, their beef is chewy, full of fat, no flavor and I can't even swallow it because I can't get passed how chewy and fat the beef was.  Yuck! Service was also slow, too.
author: Irene L.

description: had the chicken Teriaki dinner (miso with rice). Fresh, not too salty, seen this restaurant for years and never walked in, should have tried earlier... Will definitely repeat.
author: josh d.

description: Good authentic street food. I'll be honest and say not everything on their menu is great, but I love their omo rice and bento boxes (chicken teriyaki arang combo is the best). Note about the bento boxes though: the potstickers aren't that great but the rest if the sides are yummy-especially their tempts vegetables! OH and they make a mean spicy rice cakes dish-order the one with ramen noodles!
author: Sarah L.

description:
Good for late night. They are open late. Trendy music. 

Service is a hit or miss. Bibimbap is awesome here. Their seafood casserole is good too. But dont expect sll those little side dishes u get from other korean restsurant. They give u a small plate of side dishes with egg, bean sprouts, rice cake and tofu but very small. So dont expect the big size side dishes...Small restaurant so don't bring big groups there. 

DO NOT ORDER THE YOGURT SOJU ... It doesn't taste great and it's $26. Our two plates of food was only $24. Our bill ended up to be $60 with tax and tip. If the SOJU was good I don't mind paying so much for it but it wasn't good. Taste water down and a little like soda also. Weird.

But will always come back for late night food... Not drinks ;)
author: Tammy F.

description:
I would vote like 10 stars if I could. I have been going to this place for like two years now AND I FELL IN LOVE WITH THIS PLACE THE FIRST TIME. 

Here's a secret, if you go between 2-4, you get a quiet setting and maybe if you go between 3-4, or around dinner, you get K-POP playing. It's awesome. 

It's really affordable. I'm a college student , that means, almost broke and wishes to only get good but cheap food. If you are looking for a fancy high end food, well go somewhere else. 

This place is the best place for like:
-bibimbap
-bentous
-beef!!!!!!
-naengmyun
-udon
-FISHCAKE!!!!!!!! 

What I love the most are the lunch boxes. I'm going to tell you right now, the best deals are before 3. I'm giving you an hour buffer zone because iono if they actually stop serving lunch at 4 or 3. I always get the same thing, BULGOGI LUNCH BOX. Two weeks ago, I went to this place like three times in a row. KEKEKEKE. 

About the service, they never fail me. I drink tea like it's water so I'm always asking them to refill my tea so much. :p THE TEA IS REALLY GOOD. Unless you are allergic to rice, you will love it. 

If you are looking for a recommendation, I suggest:
-hamburger steak
-bulgogi lunch box
-bibimbap

I love the dessert: PATBINGOSOO. It's huge, YOU HAVE TO SHARE. It's really good patbingsoo. I haven't had a whole lot of experience eating this delicious creation but I have tried YakiniQ Cafe's and I like Arang's better. 

If you don't have time to sit down and relax in this small restaurant, then take it to go. They are the friendliest people I have ever seen. They are really nice too. I am a waitress and I learn half of my skill from them. 

I love this place so much that I recommend this place to everyone, even my own customers.
author: Cynthia D.

description: Great, tasty food...shady location.  Really enjoyed the Chicken Katsu Box and it was fairly cheap (plenty of food to eat also)!
author: Colin H.

description:
Mul naeng myun- Was okay. Didn't contain any brisket. Very odd.

Dduk bok go - made a little too quickly. Sauce was a bit watery.

Mehhh.... Will I come here again? Yes , because the prices are lower than other Korean restaurants.
author: Hye L.

description:
I barely go on yelp, and I rarely give out 5 stars. 

I believe this and Wooden Charcoal are my top two favorite korean eateries.
They have fabulous... food.
I feel like I'm at home for some reason, even though I'm not korean.
Service is fast, quick and friendly. There should be no problem with this unless you're some inconsiderate d-bag.
Great bbq meat, kimchi, fried rice, noodles, soups....
The last time I came here, I had a migraine. 
Migraines make you not want to eat.
The food was good, I was starving, I overate. WHY? Because the food was good, then of course my lovely mother ran to Safeway which is next to it for some ibuprofen :).

SIMPLY -
If you are a fan of korean food, want to try korean food, new to korean cuisine, 
try Arang Restaurant, and the rest is history. Scratch that. If you didn't enjoy it or less than expected, at least it was not dirt horrible.
This place is definitely sanitary, tidy and clean.
Chill, mellow place.
Has a bar, tables, and with bench like seatings that have high barrier - gives privacy (5 MILLION YELP STARS FOR THAT).

Why do I come here a lot? My family and relatives would look for a place to eat after work sometimes and usually... the only good place that opens up late is..this!

Closes at 2am.

Groups? 4 max is best, due to seating and the fact that it's a mellow social place.
Inexpensive.
author: Jae T.

description:
I was craving Korean food and decided to give this place a try. There's quite a few Korean restaurant options around this area but this one seemed authentic and the prices were definitely more reasonable than the others in the area. The servers are friendly but the food took a little long to come out (10-15 mins after we ordered). The meats are delicious and of good quality. I've been to many Korean restaurants and this one definitely compares well with others I've been to in the past. A good indication that this restaurant is authentic is that there were a good amount of Korean people eating here too. This restaurant is in a good location (right by Japantown) and there's a parking lot in the back.

-Beef Short Ribs Box (Dinner) - $10.95
(Meat was very juicy. The marinade was delicious! The box came with salad, soup, gyozas, noodles, and rice. For this much food, the price is definitely good for this dish. Highly recommend trying this item.)

-Soft Tofu Stew (Dinner) - $8.95
(The mild is still somewhat spicy but the broth was delicious. There were a good amount of clam meat and beef in the broth too.)

We wanted to order the Seafood Scallion Pancake too because it looked so good, but we decided not to since it would be way too much food. The pancake looked huge though (almost the size of a large plate) so it seems like it would be worth it. Can't wait to come back!
author: Angela F.

description:
Pro for a restaurant in J-Town: A free parking lot.  Arang is on the corner and is a relatively small restaurant.  Arriving at 12:00 pm sharp, we got in just in time to beat the lunch rush at 12:30 pm.  It is very affordable for Korean food lunch, and the servers are very friendly.

The bulgogi box is under $10.  The food tastes more like Chinese-Korean fusion though.  The jap chae noodles tastes chow-mein-like.  The bulgogi is a bit bland.  You also get two pot stickers that are more reminiscent of Chinese style cooking than Korean food.  If you are looking for a relatively affordable lunch box, then Arang is a good spot.
author: Steph W.

description:
Ordered the kimchi fried rice and spicy pork, shared them with one other person.  The fried rice looked like something I could've made myself, which consisted of spam, kimchi and sweet corn.  Really? Can't even add some seaweed in there?

Spicy pork was thick, which isn't like how I've had them at other places.  It wasn't bad, just wasn't great and what I had expected.  Appetizers were very limited and didn't leave me with any satisfaction and definitely didn't get me my korean cravings fixed.
author: Nancy S.

description:
After several failed attempts in the past 2 years, I FINALLY made it out to Arang.  Was it worth the wait?  Well, I think so and here are some reasons why:

1) Plenty of menu choices 
2) Service is efficient and friendly
3) The food is good.  

What I ordered:
Dol sot bi bim bap (recommend)
Beef Kalbi (recommend)
Pot Stickers (eh)

What to expect:
1) Small dining space
2) Can get hot and stuffy 
3) Quick service
4) Moderately priced  - 2 people, 4 dishes, 2 sodas=$50 (sans tip)

I'm just glad that I have a Korean resto closer my apt (my fave one is on Geary and 10th Ave, which is sorta far).
author: Hiromi N.

description: Had the soft tofu soup ($11) and the potstickers ($6.50 for like ten). It's not the greatest korean food I've ever had (e.g., it doesn't compare to Seoul or Los Angeles spots) but the quality is good and the price is decent. It's a tiny place and I came in the late afternoon but most tables were full. With one waiter for the entire room, be prepared to wait for a little bit before he can get to you
author: Ross I.

description:
What happened to this place?  It used to be so good. I always make it a point to come here whenever I'm back in town but this last visit wasn't the best.

I ordered my usual bbq beef with tempura combo and also got the seafood pancake.  The pancake was soggy and sooo disgusting.  I was quite disappointed.  

The service was friendly and I see that there are new people working there.  Not sure if the person cooking is new, too. 

I probably won't come back, unfortunately.
author: Deborah W.

description:
Arang is one of the most authentic Korean restaurants I have been to. Service is hit and miss: sometimes you have good service and sometimes you have bad service. Food here, however, is delicious! The best time to come is during their lunch hours. Their prices for their lunch menu are unbeatable for the large amount of food you get. You basically get full dinner portions for the lunch items. Their dinner menu basically has the same items as the lunch menu with more entrees but dinner is more pricey than the lunch items.They have the best tofu soup, and seafood bibambap (rice with mixed veggies and seafood in a hot stoneware bowl) in SF. Their seafood pancake is also something you should try! And see if you can get it cooked with Kimchi (only certain servers know you can add kimchi to the pancake to make it a seafood kimchi pancake). They have a variety of non-spicy dishes too for those who cannot handle the heat. They serve lots of banchan (korean side condiment dishes), and these are refillable. You just have to ask the servers to do it. Their entrees are big enough for two people to share. They also serve you green tea with toasted glutinous rice on top. They also have regular sodas, and soju (alcoholic korean mixed cocktails)! You can buy the soju in pitchers.

They play korean pop music at night, and an american light rock music station during the day time. 

There is parking on the street, and some people even park in the Safeway parking lot since the restaurant is located in the same plaza area. However do this with caution! I been told that some cars actually do get towed away for parking in the Safeway parking lot!

Other than hit and miss service, and the parking, I highly recommend this place to anyone who wants to try authentic Korean dishes.
author: Elaine W.

description: I've passed the Safeway plaza in jtown countless times but I never even knew Arang existed until recently. We ordered the duk bukki w ramen, galbi i think and another soupy ramen dish w rice cakes. Everything was a-okay but there was nothing especially memorable about the dishes we ordered. Service was on par. Music was some kind of funky throwback music which was different from the pop-y music they place in other korean places I've been to. Other than that, everything was solid.
author: Queena T.

description:
I came here with friends. Going inside man night time is going to be a pain since it going to be crowded inside, but I'm very lucky it was around 2-4pm, so it dead inside LUNCH FTW!!!. :)

Going inside you'll notice you won't be listening to some ehhh American Music instead you get K-POP! SCORE!!!! Thank you! (At least they update their music BIG BANG SINGING MY BLUE!)

TEA IS GOOD!!!! 

Anyway The menu is very simple and obviously I order Spicy Pig Pork aka daeji bulgogi (lunch boxes) very good deal, and tteokbokki is recoomended too
Food overall wise for me personally I wish it was better, but it still delicious!
Dessert who doesn't love dessert because it pretty good and I forgot what my friend order, oh well since I forgot the name of it.

Service is terrible for lunch time becuase they forgot about my table, but I won't complain because it lunch time and it empty anyway and I understand that, but night time BUSY!

Because it a small and crowded place, it so perfect to hang out with your friend, talk, chill, and it warm inside since obviously it cold outside in SF.

FYI BRING YOUR CHARGER because they got plug yeah FTW!
author: Jeff Y.

description:
Came on a Monday evening to this very small place. Came in a group of 6, waitress tried to seat us at a booth for 4 and when I asked to be moved she reluctantly obliged.  Our waters weren't refilled and she took half our orders and took another 10 mins to get the rest.  The banchan was measly & mediocre..nothing special in taste or sight. 

We had the bulgolgi, spicy pork, spicy chicken, beef bimbibap, and spicy pork bone soup.  The soup had a nice porky flavor and the spicy chicken actually tasted spicy.  Everything else was a failure.

Overall its a joint to stop in for a quick bite if you're in a rush to put something in your belly.  Don't stop by if you're looking for a good meal.  I certainly won't be back...ok food and poor service.
author: Blia L.

description:
So I don't know if I was STARVING when I came in here to eat, or if the food was really good.. EITHER WAY THOUGH... It was yummy. lol

I ordered the Kimchi Bibimbap. It was very yummy and it was definitely spicy. I've had kimchi at other Korean restaurants and sometimes the kimchi ain't spicy.. It's like, "What? o_O" Why are you not spicy? Why are you so sour? Why are you salty?" Anyway. Haha

It came pretty quickly after ordering. It was nicely portioned with the right amount of rice, veggies and all that goodness. The only weird thing about it is that they put the sauce/flavoring on it, for me.. Instead of having me do it myself..?

The rest of my party ordered their.. K-Japanese style bento boxes (which looked pretty tasty) and another ordered the Seafood BiBimBap. That too, already had the sauce on it. o__o" But it was tasty, nonetheless, they didn't skimp on the seafood. It was a bit more watery than my kimchi still pretty spicy and all that good stuff.

Not too many side dishes at this place but it's still good.

Good music to go with the meal. (; *hehehe*
author: Susan Y.

description:
Have been here many times. Love the BBQ beef, stir fried seafood, and the tofu soup. Its been our regular place for late night hang outs.
Highly recommended!
author: isabella y.

description: For some reason, the food here doesn't taste as good as it used to.  But the bento boxes are still pretty worth it.  I always get Kalbi bento box here and it never disappoints!
author: Tina L.

description: I love this place! I come here every other Monday when I'm not working. My fave dish is Seafood Bi Bim Bop. It is so delicious. I usually get it without octopus. The dish comes with shrimp, calamari and muscles. The price is reasonable. The side dish is tasty also. Love the fish cake! Another dish I tried was the fried chicken wings. The skin was crispy and crunchy--very good! If you're fan of Korean food or want to try it for the first time, I recommend Arang!
author: Teddie B.

description:
After a few weekends and weeks of traveling around, I decided that I needed some good ol' Korean food.  My coworker recommended Arang, so I headed over for lunch and was immediately overwhelmed by all the delicious choices.

Ever ask a waitress or waiter for their opinion and they really aren't helpful at all?  Yeah.

"So, between the bibimbap, kimchee fried rice and yookgaejang, which one do you recommend?"
"Ummmm... do you like seafood?"
"No, I'm allergic to a lot of seafood."
"Oh.  Well.  The seafood soon tofu is good."
"Thanks, but no, I'd rather have something else."
"Well, everything is actually good."
"Can you please just pick one that you would get?"
*Points to bibimbap*

Boom done.

And it was really good - thank you, waitress.  I don't know if the regular eat-in portion is bigger than my to-go one, but it was definitely enough food for me.  I wish I had time to dine there, because it's one of those hot stone ones, and by the time I finished my food, it was already cold.  Sigh.

My coworker swears by this place, and I just might too.  Definitely a good lunch pick, as it's 20 feet away from my other office.  What a trek.
author: Tori S.

description:
I say go here if your taste bud, as well as brain power, has numbed from alcohol...or if you wana listen to a playlist which includes...kpop music and avril lavigne.

Got the soft tofu soup and budaecchigae (stew/soup with ramen noodles, spam, sausages)

I'm pretty sure I drank twice my body weight in water to wash out the extra salt/seasoning/MSG.

If you're craving korean food - GO TO BROTHER'S on Geary and 6th. you won't regret it.
author: Ami Y.

description:
Korean food restaurants are comparable to women in SF. Numbers are limited, and it's hard to find a good one. (No offense SF ladies! And besides.. maybe you're one of the "good" ones!)

The good thing about Arang is that it's open till 2am, and there's parking. The bad thing? Well.. it doesn't compare to Korean restaurants in LA. Not even close.

I've never had soondubu (tofu soup) with cucumbers and onions in it. Wait, it's supposed to have beef and seafood? Well they put maybe one piece of each in there, and the rest were those filler veggies. The complimentary side dishes were not good at all. The other food we got was mediocre, too. 

Maybe it's unfair that I'm comparing this place to the restaurants I've had in LA, but I don't understand why the standards of Korean food in the city has to be so low!
author: Kazu O.

description:
Just returned from Arang where a friend's mother from Korea hosted a dinner for our group of 6. Our dinner was excellent.

I first ate at  Arang  a few months ago and the food was very good, but tonight's dinner was even better.

I had the salmon teriyaki, a Japanese dish, but prepared beautifully at this Korean restaurant. The salmon portion was huge and cooked perfectly. The teriyaki flavoring was subtle so the flavor of the salmon was prominent. I don't think I've ever had salmont teriyaki this good. Not one bone in the beautiful fillet. 
If you're a salmon-eater (as I am) you MUST  enjoy the salmon at Arang.

Other foods were excellent, too, as was the friendly and efficient service.

In my opinion, Arang is a gem if you like Korean, other Asian, or just superior food in general.
author: IQuack D.

description:
I came here a few times. I usually come here for basic Korean food.  There's nothing that really stood out. I usually just order the Galbi (which they cook for you before serving it to you) and the Sondopu (Spicy tofu soup) which I really enjoy on a cold rainy day.
It's a super small restaurant.  Probably only 10 tables. I think people come here to eat then karaoke next door.  Overall my experience here was just ok.
author: Ying F.

description:
Arang is halfway decent. I think the cool Korean kids all eat here. The servers sure are cool (yeah, they are!) Food comes out quickly. 

Some of their dishes are just.. I mean.. not good at all. Some of their dishes are tasty and good for a late night snack. I usually come by after watching a show at Yoshi's. I've had their budaejjigae and kimchi bokeumbab, both were tasty. Their dumplings are a different story. Not a fan :/

They aren't stingy with their banchan and they really do serve a wide variety of Korean food. Is it the best? No. Is it convenient? Yes.
author: Rosa L.

description:
We arrived around 630pm and had to wait 15 minutes for a table.  They had open tables but we were told they were reserved. I never knew this place took reservations?! 

When we were finally seated, we were given only 5 minutes to review the menu before she came back to us to ask if we were ready. She seemed to be in a bad mood and we didnt want to piss her off so we hurried and gave our order.

We ordered the spicy pork. Good flavor but lots of fat instead of meat.
We also ordered the vermicelli.  Delicious!
Our last dish was the seafood bi bim bap. I thought it tasted only ok.

We were dying of thirst because we werent served anything to drink prior to the arrival of our dishes.  We had to ask for tea and water.

For the price we paid, I would have expected a lot better.
author: Janet E.

description: It's open late for when you finish with a concert or clubbing. Their tofu soup "mild" is still spicy as hell. I love spicy but my party did not enjoy that. We got bulgogi, bi bim bap and short ribs. The prices are a little steep for the food quality you get but it's a decent option for some late night dinning if you are in the area. Bathroom is a mess as well. They are generous with the water because they serve it to you in a big container with water and they keep bringing you a new one when you finish. The bulgogi was a little on the greasy side but the flavor was nice. The tofu soup was good with meat and clams and I personally did not mind the spicy flavor. I don't like kimchi but my gf who is a big fan since she went to Korea said it wasn't good. Overall decent food that is open late.
author: Jeromy G.

description:
I really liked the music here.  They weren't playing K-Pop when I got in, which I thought was weird, since the place had a younger feel.  Instead they were playing a good mix of stuff from the 90's, early 2000's and a few non-mainstream new songs.  Very enjoyable to listen to as you wait for the food.

The wait staff was also very friendly, they got our food out quickly and were attentive with drinks and cleaning up any uncleaned tables.

The food was just ok for me, but I think that was mainly because I ordered the wrong item.  My friends ordered the galbi and they demolished it.  While I got the spicy pork bulgogi.  The meat seemed to have too much fat for my taste.  I don't know if that's supposed to be common, but most Korean restaurants where I've had it, that wasn't the case.  

Overall it was a good experience and I'll be coming back, partially because it's only a few blocks away, but also because I want to give it another shot.
author: Joe N.

description: Bulgogi is dry, service is wack. I'm hella thirsty, they didn't even give me water. Don't go here.
author: Byron D.

description:
Free parking in a lot! That's definitely a plus for this small Korean restaurant. We arrived on a Friday night and the place was full with a mostly Asian/korean crowd. Their menu is pretty extensive and prices are reasonable. They also have dinner bento boxes which is something I only see in Japanese restaurants. 

We ordered the spicy fried chicken, kalbi bento box, and one of the spicy soups (sorry, I can't remember the name but it's in a red broth). Out of those 3 things, the only thing I would get again is the bento box because it was a really good deal for the price. This is definitely a fast, quick, and easy place to get some Korean food. It wasn't as good as Han II Kwon but it wasn't as expensive either.
author: Betty C.

description:
Arang, saranghae!(I love you) lol

My friend had her birthday dinner here on a friday night and I must say it was pretty hard to find. I was told that It is right across from the panda express but there are two faces of panda express. So I went to the wrong side first. Arang is in the corner, if you will, with two korean symbols glowing in neon, but, if you look inside there will be a sign that says Arang on the wall :]

The place was pretty small, but comfortable. Waitresses were very polite and greeted us in Korean(which I love). We got seated and they served us the tea and menus. The tea had some kind of rice in it which I thought was pretty cool. It looked like hamster poo at first tho but..it wasn't, don't worry. 

Their menu has a very big variety of choices but, I eventually ordered a BBQ Beef bento box-ish deal which came with BBQ Beef ,two Gyoza(potsticker), Salad, Miso Soup, Shredded Potatoes(very good), a scoop of rice, and Vermicelli noodles. (TIP: You have a choice between getting a box or plate. Box includes all that I listed above but plate gives you more of the meat that you order with rice but excluding all that I listed earlier and plate is more expensive. I thought the box gave me plenty of meat anyway.) The meat was very tender and flavorful, but I really enjoyed the shredded potato salad thing. 

Arang is very authentic Korean. It is refreshing to see a Korean restaurant owned by and has Korean. My experience is better that way since I came for Korean food. You should try this place out!!

OH btw when you receive the bill they give you a handful of bangin Melon Gum. It tastes like Hi-Chew but you can't swallow it hahaha
author: Benson T.

description: Bad service and food. Never order the kimchi fried rice and the sweet and spicy chicken wings. Could you imagine as a customer i have to ask the side dishes or known as banchan?! Beside that, it took them forever to cook a fried chicken wings. They said its gonna be there in 20 mins. Wait for it like 30 mins and still not on my table. Avoid this place!
author: Benny G.

description:
Came here with a few friends because one of them suggested this place for Korean food. Man is this place a tough spot to find when driving down the street! It is not visable to people who drive. They need bigger signs! Parking is a b**** around here as well! 

We ordered a pitcher of cocktail soju (which was a rip! The "pitcher" was more like a small at other places and it was very light on the alcohol), seafood bibimbap (which was weird that did had already put the sauce in there for you. How are you gonna tell me how salty/spicy I want it?), Pork bulgogi and Kalbi (which they were generous about and they were both pretty good), Japchae (which was oddly watery and was like it was SOAKED in soysauce or something), and Duk Bok Ki (my favorite korean bar dish so I can't complain). 

They were cheap about the side dishes. Who does that? This place! When I tried to ask for more, they tell me they had ran out. W.T.F? Seriously? How are you going to lie to my face when I see other people getting seated and being served that? LAME!
author: Christina Z.

description: super good! The top one choice for korean food near the fillmore area! I went there every week when I lived there, never getting tried of their seafood bibimbap:)
author: Meimei M.

description:
I love coming here when I'm feening for Korean food and don't have alot of money to spend. They have individual meat combo plates (kinda like Japanese bento boxes) with vegetables and appetizers. All that for like $12 (instead of the hefty $40 you pay at other Korean restaurants for a plate of like bulgogi). I absolutely LOVE the Kim chi fried rice here. 

Small restaurant, so if you come on a fri or sat night, expect to wait.
author: Rosie W.

description:
I am not the biggest fan of fish, so walking into a place that reeked like fried fish, I was already unimpressed but i'll battle thru it if its got good food to district me with. It's a old, tiny establishment and it doesn't seem like they'd change anything to it soon. 

I was truly not happy with my meal. The banchan was mediocre if even mentionable at all. The oshinko was not pickled enough and tasted odd. 
The "kimchee fried rice" was truly sad. Maybe they should change the name to kimchee tossed rice.  It had corn, spam, kimchee and huge chunks of semi-raw onions. It was obvious they rushed thru "frying" this dish because it wasn't evenly coated with the kimchee dressing. I had big chunks of white rice that weren't even broken up and the onion wasn't  thoroughly cooked thru! I would think this is palatable ONLY if in a drunken stupor when anything would taste good, if at that. I mean, how hard is it to make fried rice?!

We also got the spicy beef vermicelli soup...which came ages later, after inquiring about it halfway thru our meal. The soup base was standard, but where are my noodles?! Is this a soup or a noodle soup? We got a few strands of vermicelli, and to make up for it, heaps of vegetable-like sticks that tasted like licorice. 

Great meal, huh? I don't understand all the great reviews. Sorry, methinks not!
author: Ly T.

description:
Haven't written a review in so long and suddenly I'm in the mood, yay!

Arang is my hotspot for korean food when I don't feel like going far. It has plenty of parking in the lot at Safeway (I usually come at night so I'm assuming it's safe...) and the food really hits the spot for me. I've been here like 3-5 times already and it has definitely been good practically every time.

My first time here I got the udon for lunch with some friends because I was not feeling korean food at the time haha, stupid me. It wasn't terribly yummy and I didn't want to come back especially in such a cramped space and it's not so ideal location haha. (That door is so heavy!)

Then I came back with another group of friends and had the real experience, bibimbap!!!! And I went a bit further and got the kimchi bibimbap! Oh man, that was satisfying for a cold day in sf, but when is it ever hot? And the appetizers/starting plate thing were yummers too. Too bad I had to keep asking for it to be refilled.

Then I had a strange craving for soondubu and I got it. Very satisfying once again, different appetizer/plate thingy that has random foods.

And it repeats like so with me leaving happy and filled. It's a bit pricey for the food probably considering the ingredients that go in there, but it's so damn good :) 

Try try try, kimchi bibimbap :))))
author: Diana L.

description: One of the best korean restaurants i have been to! the food is consistently delicious, they have a really great menu and almost everything i have tried tastes great and authentic, the best dish has to be their bibimbap, is you are there be sure to try it!
author: Pat M.

description: This place is not expensive at all, but food is just so so. We order bimbimbap, kimchi soup, and ... Beef. The bimbimbap's rice was not well cooked. The kimchi soup was better, but spicy. The beef was just okay because i prefered having more flavour in it. They gave accompaniments. However i only liked the kimchi.  Service is great.
author: Angie N.

description:
Went here a bit back and I really enjoyed my dinner! I got the soft tofu soup and my friend order the seafood bibimbap, and we topped that off with an order of kimchi pancake. 

Ok, so my tofu soup was spectacular, it hit every good point you want a dish to hit. Taste, presentation, quantity...  I was satisfied. My friend's order was pretty decent, according to her own review, but to be honest, bibimbap is bibimbap, you know what I mean?

However, the kimchi pancake wasn't too good... It was just really thick and doughy, even after we specially ordered it to be thinner and extra crispy. I wouldn't recommend anyone to get that. 

Sidenote: alcohol sale going on there. We didn't order any, but Arang has signs posted around the shop about it. Enjoy!
author: Teresa C.

description:
I came here with three other friends and we ordered a bunch of stuff. It's kind of odd to have a korean place not use korean names for their food, but I guess it's to help others out? But japchae is not vermicelli... just saying. 

Ordered a pitcher of yogurt soju. $25 bucks for NOT a pitcher. It was good, tasted like juice, very light on the soju though. Definitely not enough to get everyone nice and buzzed even. The "sidedishes" weren't really sidedishes. Also, I agree with others, the potato salad is a really oddball side to have. 

We ordered maybe too much: 

- Seafood bibimbap
* It was a little "wet" for me. There was too much sauce but it was still good. Easy on the sauce next time please. 
- Kalbi
* How can you ever go wrong? It was a little oilier than usual but still good. 
- Pork bulgogi
* Good stuff. Always a favorite of mine. 
- Some soup dish
* Clearly not memorable enough for me to remember it. I just remember it being ok. The others seemed to really like it though. 
- Duk Bokki  
* Didn't try it but I know everyone loved it, because it was gone by the time I remembered we ordered it
* Japchae
- Flavorful and delicious as always. 

Overall, it was ok to me. Good food generally but nothing very memorable.
author: Jeannie L.

description:
I think this is the best Korean restaurant in Japantown/Western Addition area.  I only go here now!!

Best ra-bbok-ki (dduk bbok kki with ramen noodles), though it can open up your wallet a little bit (it's about $11), but well worth it.

one of the guy server here has great music taste-- he'll bring in his mix cd's, with lots of good songs on there.  None of your "america's top 40" crap.
author: Eugene L.

description:
Not the best Korean restaurant but definitely one of my favorites. This place opens til 1:30am, and it's even open during holidays like Thanksgiving. The food usually comes out very quick. The waitresses are very nice, but sometimes its hard to get their attention.

Tip: When you come here, make sure at least one person doesn't order the bento box. That way, they'll give you the dish of random preserved vegetables and etc.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description: Ordered the Kalbi which was plentiful but chewy. Yukejang was pretty spicy, not bad. Nan (our usual place) which is next door is way better but we just had to try this place our given the reviews it had. Nice people but food quality just doesn't even come close to Nan.
author: Sonny V.

description:
Great little place in the Fillmore with good tasting lunch specials.My own 
personal favorite is the teriyaki chicken lunch special.Good amount of food too.Try the Gyoza! I always have to order extra for the family!
author: Buddha B.

description:
Mmm.... korean food. Need I say more? Of course!  Let's see... when I came here I believe we got kimchee fried rice, seafood pancake, and the spicy rice stick-- dukbokki. 

Food was good, tea was good. The above items are usually my "go to" items because they're my all time favorite.
author: Eugenia G.

description:
Can't tell you what actual Korean food is since I've never been to Korea and I'm not Korean. But I keep coming back here!! Maybe it's just so close to work and I'm always in the mood for something warm for lunch and about $10 you get a delicious meal that is quick and fast. 

Tip: if you go Monday through Friday, there's lunch specials from 11-4 p.m. Weekends are dinner prices only. 

It does get a little packed on the weekends, and they do not take reservations. But it's a short wait. 

What I love: 

COMBO Lunch for $8.95 and 
Seafood Be Bim Bop $7.95, 
Regular BI Bim Bop is $6.95 and it's on a hot stone bowl, so your rice is crispy on the bottom and keeps everything HOT. 
Spicy Rice Noodles 
Short Ribs, you can't go wrong. 
Kim Chi Pancake
  
I'm definitely a FAN!
author: Judi K.

description: I love this place! I always come here just for the Bi Bim Bop! It's the only thing I really eat here. I also brought my 5yr old nephew here once and he ate a whole plate of gyoza (9 of them!)!! I was super surprised that he could eat that many.
author: Darrell D.

description:
Neighborhood favorite for a non-soondubu-specific Korean spot.  This place has a toooooon of menu options (unfortunately only one soondubu option - my fave) and they do a very good job flavoring each dish.

Didn't blow me away (go to My Tofu House for that) but good, solid place for an easy weekday dinner.  (This should really be a 3.5 star rather than a 4.  ;) )
author: Judy L.

description:
Having never tried Korean food, I was somewhat excited at a last minute invitation.  Unfortunately, I did not bother to do my research and when I skimmed through Arang's menu choices, I defaulted to my usual Japanese favorite, Salmon Teriyaki.  When deciding between a box or plate, I chose the plate, thinking there would be less extra side items (which I usually waste), and went for the plate.  Turned out the plate was all Salmon in Teriyaki sauce with a few onion slivers along the sides.  The small bowl of rice was on the side along with a plate of some other side items.  

The salmon itself was okay, but a tad on the dry side.  The warm sake was presented in a little jug with two tiny tea cups.  

The service seemed to favor the right side of the dining room as we found it difficult to get the attention of our waitress as she spent a lot of time over there.
author: Carol Y.

description:
I decided to try this place because we were driving back to SF from Lake Tahoe and got back into the city before 11pm and it was still open. Otherwise the only other option would have been Won Mi which would have been more than fine. Wow... in hindsight that was big mistake to eat here. 

First of all, when we stepped into the restaurant we were told to wait 15 minutes, even though there were at least 10 open tables and the whole restaurant holds maybe 20 tables in total. Then I realized it must because they were understaffed, so we sort of shifted our way towards a booth and sat down in one that still hadn't been cleaned yet, and watched some basketball being played on the big screen TV. At this point, while sitting around in a dirty booth we also became aware that everyone who was sitting down around us was drinking and playing drinking games at their table, with food being ordered as well, but not as the focus. We also started feeling very cold, perhaps it was the hunger and the long drive, but then the high ceilings, corner location facing wind, and lack of heat in the restaurant were very apparent. By the time I walked back to my car to get everyone's ski jacket the table had finally been cleaned and we ordered a few dishes with no alcohol. 

They did not even have the normal BBQ chicken that I usually order but some Asian fusion orange chicken hybrid, Kalbi, and seafood pancake so we ordered that. The food finally came out some time later, and everything was totally forgettable... the chicken tasted a bit strange, sort of like a grilled version of something I would expect to find at Panda Express. The Kalbi was cut LA style which always reminds me of a lunchtime rice plate rather than a dinner style cut, and the seafood pancake was overfried and dripping with excess oil. 

We ate our meal in silence with regret that we had rushed back only to have NOT eaten at Won Mi across the street. Well, let's just say I won't ever be making that mistake again when faced with these 2 choices. In my mind Arang is more like a bar you can come to enjoy some big screen TV action and drinking games with your friends, just don't come for the food.
author: Mark Y.

description:
Omelet Rice all the way 
Their food is pretty good, but be careful. The karaoke place next door was robbed last time I went.  Watch your wallets and be ready to run!
author: Hyun S.

description: I have been visiting this restaurant for years and always had a great experience. Food is great, price is reasonable and service is fantastic. I also had many catering from Arang, and I couldn't possibly happier than that. I recommend highly for catering also. Thumb up!
author: Annie K.

description:
Been coming here for over two decades now and always a pleasure...

Kalbi, marinated chicken gizzard, tofu soup, bi bim bap and (of course) soju is always good for dinner.  For lunch, I always loved their arang combo box which consists of tempura, bbq beef, noodles, rice, salad, and a miso soup.
author: Patrick C.

description:
Solid 4 star restaurant

Kim chee bi bim bap
sondopu (the Korean spicy tofu soup)
short rib soup
Chicken tonkatsu
Kal bi

No.............I didn't have this all by myself.  We kinda did a makeshift family style luncheon for the 3 of us.  I was told by one of my workers that this place sucks.  Truth be told..............It's probably one of the better fast food Korean spots in the area although it is not.  

The service was fast, the food was above average, the portion was adequate, and the price was 40 dollars for 5 dishes.  We thought they made a mistake but the food is very reasonable for Korean restaurant standards.

The only thing that caught me off guard was the potato salad that came with the side dishes.
author: jason g.

description: Honestly the food here is alright, there are better Korean restaurants around San Francisco that people should go instead, unless it's their last resort. The service here is terrible due to the lack of attention the waiters pay to their customers. Furthermore, it takes a lot to get their attention while my friend had to constantly ask the server to come over to get us more water, utensils, menus, and etc. The worst part was that they overcharged me and my friends for what we had order, since we asked for separate checks we didn't know that they included tips already when we were paying, therefore we payed extra tips. The least thing they could have done was gave us a heads up, and properly give everyone a receipt for their separate checks. Also their sampler weren't that appealing either, overall I would not recommend this place.
author: Katherine N.

description: The food was horrible. And we got over charged because they included gratitude in our bills without saying anything. I got 5 bucks ripped off and all my friends who went got ripped off also. We also left them 20% tips off our whole bill when we were leaving on the table so we got more ripped off when their service was horrible. I got ripped off by 10$ in total. We had to go grab the menus because they were just chit chatting instead of taking care of their customers. And we had to constantly ask for water and basic stuff because they were too busy chilling out. They are just horrible. DO NOT go there. You will get ripped off for horrible food.
author: Sunni C.

description:
My experience at Arang was okay. Especially after my recent trip to LA & had some of the best Korean food in K-Town, Arang really can't compare.
