I love their dinner box combo here. The teriyaki chicken is so tasty. And also the items on the side. The bibimbap here is decent though. 

I really like their starter dish they give in the beginning. Mmmm.
author: Wilson Z.

description:
Good decent Korean food when you're feeling the urge.  Everything is ok, and I've had better Korean short ribs.  For the price that you're paying, it's decent food and decent portion.  Too bad the location is not in the best area and the service is really just medicore. 
If they stick you in a corner table, forget about re-fills of tea, water, extra fork or anything b/c they will rarely check in on you.
author: AhLin C.

description:
Korean is my favorite food!  I love how there are so many side dishes that complement the main dishes so well and induce an orchestrated medley of flavors and spices in your mouth! 

Arang is pretty decent for Korean food! Get the spicy pork and try to stay away from the bul-go-gi if possible, as it is sub-par.  But the spicy pork is hella good, with just enough spicyness and sauce to cover the rice.  I love the bento boxes that also come with dumplings, salad, and potato crisps.  

I would definitely recommend this place a chill meal, without the steep prices of many Korean restaurants in SF.  Oh how I miss the cheap and better tasting Korean food of LA K-Town...
author: James C.

description: Their bento lunch specials are worth checking out.  For $7, it's a good deal.  You get meat, rice, kimchi, japchae, and salad. Their soondoobu jigae also is decent for their lunch special price.  It's not amazing food, but for the LUNCH price it's worth it.
author: C A.

description: the clay pot's to die for!! so yummy!! whenever I come here, that's what I order!
author: Ann T.

description:
Food good!  Price okay!  Music cheesy!  Open late..Yay!!  The place to be after the after party..

Three dishes to try:

Bi bim bap
Egg omelet
Beef bento box w/tempura

**you always get a plate of appetizers like cucumber in hot sauce, fried tofu..yummy fun stuff

DO NOT TRY: 

Beef short ribs in clear yam noodle soup--it's bland

I love the Hite beer and it's half price after hours, I think..
SOJU is good too, very fruity and light, but after a few glasses, you won't know what hit you!  That's the best part.

Don't forget the 20second watermelon gum they give you with your check!  (that's how long the flavor lasts)

Just a tip--Try to sit in the front, otherwise they treat you like a redheaded stepchild if you sit towards the back..
author: C Q.

description: Open very late night! It's not a bad place to go! Open until 2am everyday~
author: virginia y.

description: I eat here at least once a week! This is my favorite authentic Korean restaurant in San Francisco.  The prices are very reasonable and the flavor has never disappointed.  I even brought a visitor FROM Korea and they said it matched the flavor and taste quality of Korea.  The location is a bit hidden in the Safeway plaza, but its great for a casual cheap meal.
author: Sun M.

description:
bulgogi
bim bim bap

these are the only things i have ordered because marilyn moved to new york and my whiteness is afraid to venture out and accidentally order something that looks like cold kimchee fishcake soup...

5 stars

service?  - 2

korean beer?  a plus

GREAT korean bbq...  free parking nearby and hardly ever crowded?  thank you!
author: Lauren R.

description:
This is the only korean place that I know of in the city so this review may be a bit biased (btw, I'm not korean so don't read this for "authenticity":

I really dig the seafood udon. What I like about it is that they actually put REAL seafood in it (blue crab, shrimp, scallops), unlike other restaurants where they put a few slices of imitation crab meat in it and deem it "seafood". Ugh. 

I also like the fact that they open late, perfect for a night owl such as myself.
author: Albert C.

description:
Great cheap eats!  My favorite is the spicy pork (dwae ji bul go gi) outside of my auntie's back home - this one is pretty good. The sauce is not bottled and you can taste the difference.  Go for the kimchee bokkum bap - it's pretty fun too!  Our version of fried rice!
The service varies on how busy it is -or NOT!
author: sHoo o.

description:
Very affordable Korean food and a good selection. Ordered the giant spicy casserole full of spam, hot dog, kimchi and ramen. Tons of tasty food for like $23 but the ingredients were probably worth $5. Devoured the whole sodium-loaded meal with another friend as others at surrounding tables ate it among 6 people.

Service is pretty shitty, don't know if they forget or just ignore you. Just wanted my water refilled man.
author: Ed L.

description: I'm not that picky when it comes to food but this place uses too much msg on their food. and the prices tend to be high compared to similar restaurants.
author: Michelle J.

description:
No matter how hard I've tried, I haven't learned to enjoy Korean food.  I think getting food poisoning in Korea was the beginning of the end of our relationship.  Therefore, like the meat I ate, my perspective is probably tainted.

The staff is friendly.  Prices are great, open late!

Food - not so much.  The beef was borderline rancid.  Korean beers give me a headache.
author: Mark W.

description:
Bi Bim Bap is my new favorite hangover food.

Think about it, a steaming, heaping bowl of rice, meat and vegetables just waiting to please your empty, booze-soaked stomach.

Throw in a tall OB or Hite beer and I'm good to go.

I'll admit my knowledge of Korean dining and restaurants is fairly minimal but I had a great meal here.  The lunch special is pretty good, with that heaping bowl of goodness coming it at $6.50.  Consider it an option when you're "working from home" (i.e. spending all day watching TV and checking your email maybe once every hour because you were too lazy to come in).  Yeah, the crazy techno mash-ups of 80's songs can start to make you feel like you're at a rave but it's not necessarily a bad thing given I walked away from this place with one of those damn songs stuck in my head.  If I had drank like 6 more beers I probably would've started dancing.

The staff were all very friendly when I came.  Being able to park free of cost is a great selling point for me as well.

I think I'll get tanked tonight just so I can come by here tomorrow....
author: Steven R.

description: Can't believe I haven't written a review for Arang yet. It's been one of my favorite Korean restaurants for years. The place can get pretty crowded during peak times but they are open pretty late which is nice because thats when I always crave it. They do take reservations though so take advantage of that because the restaurant itself is on the smaller side. The bento boxes are a great deal but you won't get banchan if you order one. So just make sure someone else in your group orders something else. They don't have a problem refilling the banchan if you ask nicely. The a la carte bbq are always tasty (the spicy pork is my favorite). The casseroles are super filling and can feed 3 easily and the still give you a bowl of rice on the side! I like the spam and sausage one. It comes with kimchi, rice cakes, ramen, and an assortnent of veggies on top. You let it cook down over the little stove they bring to the table and then help yourself. Service is attentive, the food is delicious and prices are fair. Plus you can park in the Safeway parking lot!
author: Sarah L.

description:
If you're looking for a decent Korean meal, especially late in the evening, Arang is the place to hit.  The food will satisfy your Kalbi and Be Bim Bap craving, but unlike other Korean places, they don't serve much as far as appetizers are concerned.  The kimchee is pretty tasty.  They also serve a great iced tea.

You don't come here for the ambiance or the service.  They play loud, out-dated music, which can get annoying when all you want is a good meal and good conversation.  The staff often forgets about you.  You're advised to ask for 3 glasses of water from the get go, if you tend to drink a lot, like me.

If you're hungry for Korean and don't know where to go, it's not a bad place to try.  After reading the other reviews, I'll have to try Won Mi just because I know there's gotta be a great Korean restaurant somewhere around here...
author: Annalynn C.

description:
I've been here twice, both times for a late dinner. Once before a concert at the fillmore and once just cause it's close to my house. 

I like that it feels like a time warp in there, in the sense that you go in there and can spend a few hours and not even realize how much time has passed. I guess part of why I gave 4 stars is that I like the atmosphere there.  I loved that we were setting there for a while without the waitress bothering us.  Don't get me wrong, she was plenty attentive, but it was nice to have time to sit and chat and not feel rushed. 

Food was good both times but not super outstandingly delicious. We got the combo boxes both times with the following mains: chicken katsu, tempura, bbq pork short ribs and bbq beef. All pretty good and flavorful. 

I like that the combo comes with edamame and miso soup, in addition they have the meat, noodles and potstickers. I usually avoid the rice and "salad" because it's not that delicious and just filler. I find the rest of the food gets me plenty full. 

Yum.
author: Elsa E.

description:
at one point in july, i was was going to arang for dinner once a week! the food here is great for its price! i always get the bbq pork dinner box, its not too spicy and it's a perfect portion for me. 

This is a small restaurant with 2 workers there, so service might be a bit slow during the weekends because it tends to get pretty packed. I see a lot of people do go there for birthday celebrations.  

If you're in the area and looking for a cheap quick bit, this is the place to go! It's easy to find parking because there is a huge parking lot right outside where safeway is.
author: Jenny G.

description:
I totally expected to be the first to review this place, but of course it has 80 reviews. Go Yelp!

I often get the dinner bento boxes (chicken katsu, tempura) to-go. Does that make me totally boring? I hope not, because they're delicious. I enjoy most of the things they come with: 2 pot stickers, white rice, salad, vermicelli. Plus miso soup in a to-go container.

CONS: They once gave me the wrong dinner to-go, and last time they tried to charge me double.

PROS: Good food, nice staff, open late. Still worth stopping by.
author: Matt N.

description:
I haven't eaten here recently, but I always come here with two of my good friends and order the same stuff every time. Usually we come a bit early to beat the crowd, otherwise we end up sitting around and waiting for a good 15-20 minutes and then I end up a starving child -sad face-. When they get busy, they tend to ignore you even when you're trying your hardest to get their attention. So minus one star. But they are a really great place to have late night Korean food.
Here's what we typically order:
Man Du Gook - korean dumpling soup with vegetables and beef. 
Fried Gyoza - fried potstickers (Mark's favorite dish always lol.)
Ramen - spicy korean ramen with vegetables and seafood

And sometimes we randomly order things that catch our eyes.. try not to stay with the same stuff every time lol. I have the say that I LOVE Man Du Gook a lot, I have to order this every time I go, its a comfort food for me. Try it out -smile-
author: Linda X.

description:
Not the best Korean restaurant I've been at, however, in terms of convenience in terms of variety of menu and price, this place is a good place to go just to get a simple meal without having to plan or think ahead.  It stays open pretty late, and is definitely better than Won Mi which is located across the street on Fillmore.

The downside is the fact that since the restaurant is so small, there are times when you have to wait upwards up to 30 minutes.  

Good thing that they allow you to do take out.
author: Yoonsang Y.

description:
If I could marry this place...I WOULD...trust me! I love it here. The first I came here was on a first date a couple of years ago. Date gone bad...but meal gonna reaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaally RAD! 
Since then, I've compared EVERY Korean place to this place and NOT one has been up to par! And there are A LOT of good Korean places in the this Asian Infused City. I even had my 26th birthday party here and I was sooo happy and satisfied I didn't care if we went out afterwards. Get the Bi Bim Bap, Galbi, Spicy Pork and Spicy Tofu Soup...DONE AND DONE! 
This place will change your life!
author: Mary B.

description: If you're looking for good Korean food here, you'll probably be disappointed. This place will serve after-hours if you beg in the native tongue though (even in badly broken and heavily-accented varieties), so 3 stars.
author: Leo K.

description:
Food in the city generally runs pretty high, especially for Korean food. This place is very reasonable priced and the food is consistently good. There's a pretty decent variety on the menu and the portions are large, especially the bento box. Staff is friendly, booths are cute, and although I haven't tried it, people seem to love their sojus. 

Been going here for a few years and will keep coming back  :)
author: Candy C.

description:
This restaurant has become quite a favored spot for my  friends and I. Reason why is that its serve good food! lol like my buddy mark said on his review "two of my friends usually get the OB beer along with their dish so they really enjoy this place" which is true haha.. 

well lemme break it down on pricing, service, and food quality.

The pricing is kinda on the high end side.
the plate that my friend and I away gets runs about 15 bucks each for a small plate of beef and pork.  They change per bowl of rice now... which they didn't do before.  Most plates cost about 10 bucks or more.

The service is OK i guess well on a slow night its excellent!! but when its busy they don't really have a waiting list. They tend to find a table for the amount of people and whatever goes. Also they expect a heavy tip, the 15% rule or some crap. which I believe is BS tip should be the way the customer feels on how good is the food/service.

Food quality!
good,tasty, filling should i say anything more?

over all good food ok service = happy me lol
author: John A.

description: Arang is the typical Korean restaurant. The price is pretty cheap for its big portion lunch menu but the taste is just meh... I've experienced better. That's why I give it a 2** The tofu soup was notably bad. The tofu was burnt and it tasted just plain bad. The tea is the only thing that I think deserve better than 2**. Maybe 4**** because I like tea? But will you go to eat Korean when you just want to order their tea?
author: Cliff T.

description:
I love the tea with rice.  I love their bulgogee.  I love their pancakes.

The first time I ever had Korean food was here, and I thoroughly enjoyed it.  I did return a second time, but the beef wasn't as good as the first.  However you never forget your first, and I'll probably return in the future.  I have no complaints with the service, although the place is a little small.  Parking is easy, as they have their own lot for the small shopping center thing that it's in.
author: Derrick D.

description: Since my apt is right by this restaurant, i go there at least once a week. Food is great, i love their kimchi fred rice and pork feet! Theri service is ok but not great.
author: William C.

description: YUMMY, DIVY Korean spot in the Fillmore. Their bibim naengmyun is to die for. Get a bit of the naengmyun broth and some vinegar in the bowl and it reaches a God-like status. The fact that they have PATBINGSOO (a good one at that) made the inner child in me sing and frolic in the land of happiness and joy. You shan't be disappointed.
author: CHRISTIAN P.

description:
The food is spicy that it'll make your nose drip like a waterfall. 

Arang is one of the better Korean places in San Francisco. Coming from the land of Koreans (Southern California), my palette has been spoiled and expectations are high. 

Dinner was chol myhon, bulgogi, dukboggi (sp?), and a fish egg chiggae. I was pleasantly surprised by the dukboggi, it was pretty tasty and had some fire in it. The bulgogi was average, quantity was meager for the price we paid. The fish egg stew was spicyyyyy.... The highlight of the night was the chol myhon. Very good and chewy. Just enough kick that didn't overpower the rest of the dish.
author: Teresa Y.

description:
I haven't been here in years, but I have some great memories of this place.... If I can only remember them...  This was when I was young, the liver was plump, and "evil sam' was at the height of his powers.

The food is good; you can do worse.  Bi Bim Bop rocks.  The Short Ribs are good.  And I love the complimentary chicken katsu and potstickers.  I wonder why we get the free food... must of been the tab we ran up from all the soju and chamisul.
author: Sam T.

description: This used to be our Korean spot when we first moved to the city. Good portions and prices, and always easy enough to get a table. After a brief spell out in the Richmond where we found the Korean choices surprisingly sparse or on the pricey side, we are happy to be back in the neighborhood and are excited to stop back into this hidden little spot.
author: Danny M.

description: Looking for a lunch place while wandering around SF randomly. Nice selection of lunch options--I got a bulgogi bento box. Didn't taste like what I expected, but marinated beef is hard to mess up (I think?). Some of the side items in the box were lackluster, but the mandu were good and so was the potato side. Pretty solid lunch (very inexpensive).
author: Sandy N.

description:
I've first heard about this place from Linda W. She said it was cheap and good. I've walked and drove by the place many times before but have never stepped inside until a friend of mine and I decided to catch a late dinner. We weren't looking for anything fantastic, just a place that is still open on a thursday night at 11:30pm. He suggested Arang. 

"ooooh" I told myself. Linda was just telling me about this place.

It was meant to be....for me to try this Korean joint. 

It reminded me of Toyose because they open late and they serve the exact same food...almost- oh and they have bento boxes in their menu.  Their side dishes aren't as great as other korean restaurants, service sucks, bento box =), miso soup (yuck), and the bibimbob was ehhhh. 

It was cheap and I will most likely go back again...one day.  As one of my friends would say it "Try it twice, just to make sure you don't like it."
author: Jenny K.

description:
People often think I'm Korean so I feel weird going into a real Korean place.  Luckily no one started talking to me in Korean, and I took my white friend's recommendation which was really good (Bim-Bim-Bap?)

Service was a bit random, but I don't think that's the primary reason to go here.  I would give it an extra half star for the melon gum too.
author: Gene X.

description:
it won't be the best korean food you'll ever have... 

however.. and you really can't go wrong if you just wanna chill.. with cheap beer.. decent flavored soju.. decent korean food.. good friends..
author: Stan L.

description:
Not so much...

It's a Korean restaurant that gives you Miso soup with each lunch entree ?!? I soon found out it dabbles in other Japanese food as well - tempura, ton katsu, teriyaki....random! But what the heck...gotta try it right? The potstickers (also included with the lunch entree) tasted like they were frozen and microwaved right before serving. The vermicelli glass noodles (chap chae?) were dry and didn't have much flavor. The bi bim bap did look good, but the ton katsu was run of the mill. Of course you also get your typical lettuce with Thousand Island as your salad. 

So bottom line...the food ain't all that. But for lunch specials, they do give you quite a lot. It's not bad food...just nothing special.
author: Samir P.

description:
During lunchtime, their bi bim bap is off the chain!11  I have yet to find a better one in the city for the same price.  

One my fav watering holes in SF.  The staff are nice, parking can be found in the Safeway lot.  You kind of just keep ordering food, and alcohol, and food, and alcohol, and more alcohol.  Laf.
author: Dong T.

description: The food is pretty good, once it shows up, if they got the order right, and of course if they bothered taking your order in the first place. Woe unto you if you expected any small yummy kim chi plates before the main course.
author: Aaron S.

description:
Got taken here for my first time a few months back. Couple weeks later, I took my gf. And most recently, maybe 3-4weeks ago. And usually it's late at night (after 10 or 11p.m.) because really, when we can't think of places to go, it's Arang to the rescue.

The first time was great. We had kimchi fried race, a plate of the chewy rice noodles, and a plate of bulgogi. I had never had the chewy stuff before so it took a while getting used to the extra chews I had to take before swallowing, but it was pretty good after that. Some of you might find it very different from "regular" textured food, so be careful.

The second time, I had the tofu soup and my gf had the bento box. The soup was okay, I've had better. The tofu had a good consistency (I think...). Bento box, eh..I never really bother with buying these anywhere. It's just the default item you choose when you can't make up your mind.

The most recent time I go the mackerel. I had eaten some a week or two before it and was just craving some more, so I ordered it. It came out EXTREMELY OILY! be forewarned..each bite of it and I could feel the oil oozing from the fish. I had to grab 2 napkins to pad that sucker down before it was safe to eat, haha. But once I did that, it was pretty good.

Overall, 4 stars. Food is pretty decent, parking is widely available with the huge lot right there for Safeway. Then again, I've always been there late at night with no one around, so I can't say during the day. Service is shoddy..the ladies don't come by often enough, so I feel you guys about the water refills. Maybe the ladies are so tired by the time I get there? haha But really, I don't expect great service when I go to Asian restaurants. Growing up in Vietnamese in San Jose and going to all the Viet restaurants has set my standards a little lower than the norm :P
author: Tinothy M.

description:
If you don't look carefully for this place, you're sure to miss it.  It shop front is literally the size of 2 doorways.  Arang is found inside the Safeway plaza on Webster/Geary a few doors down from the Subway Sandwich shop.

I've only been there once so far and I got bi bim ba for takeout.  Based only on that I'd give it 4 stars.  The beef was prepared well, not too fatty.  There was a decent mix of vegetables and it's served with a bowl of miso soup.  All in all, I would go back to try other items.
author: Hui C.

description:
hooray for arang! I love the ramen, I know I can go out and buy the package and cook it at home and it will be exactly the same, but the whole point is, I go to arang when I don't want to cook.  Plus, they put all sorts of tasty extras in like eggs, onion, etc. and you can ask them to make it extra spicy!

bf always gets the dinner boxes, those are pretty tasty as well, there's a bbq pork one - every time he gets it, I steal some :D

love the fact that it's open late, and i love the tea there - anyone know what kind of tea it is?  it's little grains at the bottom but it doesn't taste like the barley tea you normally get at korean restaurants . . .
author: Vicki Y.

description:
My friend and I both had sore throats and needed some hot, spicy Korean soup.  And pronto!!  Rather than risk having to wait in line at My Tofu House, we decided to try a new place - plus it was closer to his place.

I ordered the Soondubu Chigae/soft tofu soup.  He ordered the Kimchee Chigae/kimchee soup.  And we split an order of Mandoo/Korean pot stickers.  Soondubu Chigae was mild to medium spicy, but at Arang they add sesame oil to the broth.  What it lacked in spicy kick, the sesame oil made up for in taste  My friend's Kimchee Chigae was ok.  Nothing to call Mom about.  The Mandoo were nicely pan fried, but definitely could've had more filling.

The panchan was - meh.  Slice of steamed egg custard, fried tofu, potato salad (sweet - yuck!), radish and cabbage kimchee, little anchovies.

Service was ok.  Decor - very lacking.  But we parked in the strip mall parking lot, got seated right away, and they were ready to take our orders within 5 minutes of us sitting down.  So all-in-all not a bad experience.

Oh yeah, and if you so happen to take advantage of their booze specials (I guess all booze prices were reduced?) and can manage to muster up the courage, you can also go next door to the Norebang/karaoke bar.
  :D
author: Anonymouse C.

description:
i first came upon this place after watching a show at the fillmore, and i must say that it was a fitting end to an already awesome evening.  the prices are very reasonable, and the food is great.   To add to everyone elses recommendations, i agree, try the Bi Bim BAP (it sounds like an onomatopoeia, or sound effect for all you laymen out there lol j/k...), it's really good.

and you can also look throught their korean magazine, from what i can tell they are fashion magazines.  Fun to look at.
author: derrick i.

description: I love this place! Been coming here since I was in high school so 10+ years ago. Their spicy pork is actually quite spicy and flavorful!! Decent prices and I am usually here for lunch. I do wish customer service is a bit better because my cup of tea is ALWAYS empty and I always have to ask. They should put a teapot for each table because I drink a lot of tea. Sometimes, I feel bad asking for more tea when I don't think I should to begin with. Their Bi Bim Bap is pretty good as well.
author: Willa L.

description: I've been here twice and I've enjoyed both times pretty well. I haven't had anything but their jigae and tenjang, so I'm not sure about their other items. But their jigae is pretty delicious. Their side dishes are also pretty good. The service wasn't amazing or anything, but it's better than most Korean restaurants I've been to. It's not ridiculously expensive either. I say it's a pretty decent place to go to. One bad thing is that both times, I had to wait a bit for a seat cuz the restaurant is pretty small. However, I recommend this restaurant and I would definitely come to eat here again!
author: Momo C.

description: I give this place all 5 stars... sure, it's a dive.  But this place has been around since Cain was cleaning sheep skins.  I mean,  this place is a freakin institution!   And surprisingly, the food is really good.  Boo dae jjee geh, kimchi jjee geh, kalbi.  you name it.  whatever they have is at least as good as all the other korean places.  also, the pat bingsoo is really good too.  finally, they serve soju... cocktail and straight.  now, who doesn't love that?
author: paul l.

description:
I'm sorry but Korean food in SF doesn't compare to K-town in LA, but this place is decent.  Mind you I've only been here once so its review isn't as fully informed as possible because I am much more critical with Asian foods.  However, if I lived in SF, I would probably go back to give some other dishes a try.  It is a small hole in the wall again with Korean music playing in the background.

I got the yu-kae-jang (spicy shredded beef soup), and to my happy surprise, it wasn't that bad.  My friend got the kal-bi tang and said it was ok.  They also provided panchan (the little appetizers with dinner) which included a pretty good spicy pickled cucumber and kimchi.
author: Nicky C.

description:
AH! I like!~ Good side dishes (bean curds and kimchi!) 

I like cheap korean food. Bim bip bap was good.... it could use more toppings.. but at least they got the egg right!
author: Helen H.

description:
Arang has basic Korean food at fairly inexpensive prices. I especially love their peach soju and bibimbap (rice and veggies in stone bowl).  Everything else doesn't stand out too much though. It's a great hang out for drinks and snacks; I think that the main reason why most people go there. Plus, they open fairly late. 

It's a rather small restaurant with approx 8 tables. There's not much privacy and the background music is fairly loud. So, definitely not a date restaurant but it's a good place to hang with friends over a bottle (or ten) of soju. Most of the waitress do not speak English well so don't expect to customize your food. But they're very amiable and nice. So if you want more kimchi, just ask! 

BONUS: It's right next to a Chinese karaoke place. So, if you want some entertainment after the drinking... =)
author: My V.

description:
Came here for a friends birthday dinner. I think I consumed more meat in an hour and a half then I have in the last six month but it was definitely worth it. The place is tiny and minimally decorated but the food is good and cheap. I loved the kimchee soup and, binimbap, and the BBQ beef.  You don't cook at the table so you can definitely go out after the meal which is a nice plus.

The service is  adequate at best and they have a very small liquor selection which detracts from the meal as a whole. I would definitely come again when I have a craving for Korean BBQ.
author: Courtney R.

description:
So, I'm a little bit strange when it comes to Korean food. I never like all the little appetizers they give you and the only things I really like are the omelette thing and Korean-style ramen.

It's hella hard finding Ramyun (Ramen) at the Korean places around Japantown-we did some hard searching and this was the only place that has it. The Ramyun was good for all the reasons I go to a restaurant for Korean ramen-it was hot and spicy, prepared with eggs and they even threw in some shrimp in there. 

My friend ordered Seafood Bibimbap and while I'm kinda iffy about beef bibimbap, my friend's seafood Bibimbap was really good! Maybe I'll break out of my rut and try that next time. 

The ambiance was cozy and laid-back. It took a WHILE for them to notice that we were ready to order-this is why I wouldn't recommend sitting at any table outside of the vicinity of the counter. The prices are very reasonable (the ones closer to Japantown tend to be pricier), so maybe what you lack in service, they make up for in prices?
author: Jenny W.

description:
The food here is so good that you'll eat like a pig. So comforting and yummy... I will come here regularly now. 

The only complaint was that the beef short ribs weren't as sizzling hot as we'd hoped, and the dol sot bimbimbap was REALLY good but again, would have liked it to be super mega hot. Just sayin'.
author: Kanna L.

description:
Great selection of food and although not so authentic, really bloody good and cheap.
Great for take away or eat in and always end up meeting friends in there randomly (they supposedly dont control this but i am not sure about that)
gold
author: Nathan H.

description: Had a wonderful time there, its a small but attractive little place. They had a good ambiance going.  The food was good, the people were nice, no complaints :)
author: Big K.

description: K-pop music and good korean food.  I was a happy person even though it was raining crazy hard outside and I didn't have an umbrella.  Anyway, I was specifically in awe by the exceptional service from the waitress.  I was so impressed that I left them a huge tip.  They were super busy, but yet so attentive.  Service can't get any better than that.
author: Erika C.

description:
Nice little late night hangout for a quick bite to eat and soju.  They don't close until 2am. All alcoholic beverages are 50% off until the end of February!  So it's only $12 for a large pitcher of flavored soju right now!  You seriously can't get that deal anywhere else. Even at the original price, it's a steal.  Unfortunately, they only offer two kinds of flavored soju which is either lemon or peach.  Actually both flavors taste pretty much the same so it really doesn't matter which one you order.  The soju tastes great and it will get you buzzed before you realize it!

The food isn't anything to rant and rave about but it really isn't bad.  I've only tried the bibimbap and the tofu soup so I really can't say much but the food definitely has a homemade feel to it.  And the two ladies that work there are super nice.  A bit slow and forgetful sometimes on the service end but their friendliness definitely makes up for that.
author: Joyce W.

description:
Parking was a b*tch.

Food was okay. I had the BBQ Beef and Tempera combo... which came with salad, miso soup, vermacelli, 2 potstickers, and potato thingies. Lunch special ends at 4... (Parking made us late!) Service was so-so, they didn't really check on us, and they didn't really refill tea until my friends & I were about to leave.
author: Allyson L.

description:
SF Food Inspection Score: 96

I had a fantastic meal here yesterday when I was on a break from work. 

The service was quick even though the server was super busy with big party tables and kids crying in the restaurant. 

I love that they serve robatayaki. I love inexpensive food on skewers! But they were out of shrimps....

I definitely want to go there again to have a more tradish Korean meal because I mostly had Japanese influenced dishes (ramen and robatayaki).

I'm ready to try the bi bim bap next time!
author: Kristina C.

description:
Went here on a random monday night, somewhat busy, BUT had enough seating for those coming in.

Good food for a good price. Although the food isn't anything significantly different from other korean places, it's still good!
author: Dan N.

description: While exploring Fillmore St in San Francisco, nearby the Fillmore Center., I came across this small restaurant. The atmosphere is nothing to rave about. I tried their Bi Bim Bop and it came in a smoldering hot pot.  Just the way I like Korean food. And it hit the spot.
author: Thuy V.

description:
The food has gotten better.  I've lived in the neighborhood for over 7 years now and this is a place I go to when I'm just too tired to cook (which is almost always) and I don't want to go far.

The trick to this place is knowing what to order.  Skip the ordinary dinner boxes and order some of their specialties like galbi tang (short beef rib soup), their crazy meat combination spicy ramen, or their hamburg steak.

EDIT:  Also try the kimchi fried rice!!!
author: Augie C.

description:
4 stars because this is one of those restaurants that is ideal for those evenings when you just want to sit down and chat with friends over food and drinks without being hurried to get out. The restaurant is small but depending on which seats you get it may be cozy. The music is not too loud so you can still have good conversations. 

They never rush us to leave as long as we keep ordering a drink every now and then. (the peach soju and plum wine is worth trying) At times they also surprise us with an extra dish on the house!
author: Stephen S.

description:
Great place to eat, at least you can get a really nice portion of Korean food for about half the price (approx $10) rather that the usual full-portion ( $20) which is on offer at many Korean joints in the area.

Cool dinner box combinations on offer, bento-box style.

I used to live right by this place back in 2002, and used to come here every other day. The menu has changed since then - now there is more to choose from !
author: Lisa M.

description:
Arang is my favorite korean restaurant!! 
the service is ok. Mostly there are crowded.
the place is small, but food comes fast.

Soft Tofu (Sundubu) Jjigae is wonderful!
Oh, I wanna have one right now...
author: Necobs M.

description: Very good quality tasty Korean food., especially considering the reasonable price. Ensure you get the correct change though when you pay.
author: J M.

description: I haven't been here in awhile but thought it was ok overall. The menu has changed and added quite a few items that were pretty good. The pork was tasty and the fried chicken was good.
author: Mary L.

description:
Great food, good prices.

The lunch box/dinner box specials are an excellent meal, and for only $8.50 at dinner time.  

Drinks are well priced, consisting mainly of Korean beer and sake as well as soju.

Service: service is a little sub par, but when I visit Arang, I'm in the minority, they may get a couple of annoying tourists that drop in, and I used to get mistaken for one.

Open til 2:00AM, one of the best places to eat in filmore/japantown area
author: Luke G.

description: I'll have to reevaluate this restaurant as I ordered something and received the wrong order. Food was OK portions were small and service wasnt good as it was a waitor error and no compensation.
author: Len A.

description: This place is pretty much a hole in the wall. I never knew about this place until my boyfriend took me there. We've been there quite a few times ever since then. The restaurant itself is small but cozy. If you're looking for something authentically Korean, this place isn't really it. There's more of a Japanese feel to the place rather than Korean (other than the hip Korean music that other Korean restaurants don't play). The waiters and waitresses here are really friendly. The food here is decent and reasonably priced. There's typical stuff like chicken teriyaki bento boxes or beef short ribs bento boxes. Give the bi bim bap a try. It actually comes fresh and hot in a stone pot. Other Korean places just put it in a bowl nowadays. The Beef udon was just okay. Have a taste for yourself. :]
author: Janice M.

description:
Arang is amazing. That's that. Good Asian food is in such short supply: vendors are so willing to sacrifice authenticity for profit. They pander, as such, to the milder tastebuds of most Americans.

Not Arang. When I stepped in, I immediately felt out of place. The only Korean I know is annyeong and kimchi. That's a great thing when you're looking for good Korean food. Service is great, and the waiters and waitresses are your typical polite Korean types.

Their kimchi soup is great, but give the fried rice a miss - it's a bit bland in comparison to the other food. They also serve a mean hotstone bibimbap, so if you're a fan of the rice taking on that delicate charred taste, be sure to order yourself one. We didn't have the big hotpot, but it sure looked amazingly tasty.

Banchan (side dishes) could have been a lot more generous. But servings were pretty huge, so it didn't really matter in the end.
author: Jireh T.

description: I am a big fan here, and have been coming to this place since for about 10 years. The service here is getting worst and worst.
author: jennifer l.

description: I had the #3 lunch special of BBQ beef ribs for $8 - 9, with beef, salad, vermicelli, potato, and rice. IT WAS ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS~! I was super stuffed yet still craving for more beef. The only disappointment I had was with the free side dishes, maybe I've been spoiled by the other Korean restaurants I've dined at, but they were very tiny portions.  I usually cannot handle spicy food, but the kimchi here was just perfect.  Can't wait to come back!! :)
author: Jen P.

description:
korean food seems expensive these days... 
$23 for a large pot of boiling stew:  veggies, spam, ramen.  
i think the novelty is its cooking right in front of u on a portable stove, and that's wat im paying for, since the food was just ok.
$9 for fried mackerel.

$40 total after tip.
author: Ethan L.

description:
Great value - food is good and relatively cheap. the ramen dduk boki is legit.

Good for casual meals & drinking with a few buddies. we get together once every couple months for "arang night"...and it means eating a smackload of kfood and playing titanic with soju til we all blackout.
author: james l.

description: WAY WAY WAY WAY overrate. i've been saying that for years.  The food isn't that good, the atmosphere is terrible.  I would understand if your drunk at karoke and you stumble in here and you think it's good.  Try to eat here sober. do not bring kids here.
author: kevin h.

description:
i literally grew up here. should be automatic five stars for having to deal with me through the years, but this isnt a babysitting review. 

throughout the years, the quality has been fluctuating alot. ask me two years ago, id say go for the soj and some chigae. as of late, i would actualyl go there to eat. i must admit the food is getting better. id rate it a three but for trying to improve their game, plus one star.
author: Euge L.

description: I love their food here.  It's so flavorful and spicy and hot.  I believe they close late on fridays and saturdays.  Maybe like at 1am or 2am.  Becareful parking in the lot bc last time my friend got her vehicle towed.  To retrieve her ride, she had to fork out over $400.  For some reason that night the idiot security guard inside safeway was keeping tab on ppl parking in that lot.  Literally we saw tow trucks coming in and out towing ppl's car.  The messed up thing was Arang had a notice written in Korean telling their customers not to park in the lot.  Ummm... Hello, non Korean readers need translation.  Would be helpful to have made that in all different languages or maybe just in English.
author: Mimi S.

description: Arang is great option for quick and cheap Korean food.  Michael Bauer confirms this on his list of cheap eats on sfgate.  They have bento boxes, kalbi, bulgolgi, and more importantly, alcohol that always claims it is on sale for a limited time only.
author: Dennis L.

description: Decent Korean food for a decent price w/ a side order of PARKING. You can't beat that for the area.
author: Kevo M.

description:
Just had lunch here less than an hour ago, and if only i had a stomach -- I'd go back for more! It is Oh-So-GOOOD!

I had the lunch Seafood Bi-Bim-Bap in hot stoneware, for $7.50!!! There were about 5 HUGe and fresh shrimps in the pot, with abundance squid and some calamari. Not too much rice. And, the flavoring is perfect! I'm a big eater, and I was barely able to finish the whole thing, so I guess we can call that a BIG portion.

The service wasn't at your beck-n-call like a high-class place, but they're definitely attentive. The servers came to check on us twice to make sure that everything was OK, that's a lot to say for lunch hours.

We were lucky that there were no wait because this place is very small. And, for the price and quality they offer, I'm sure Korean food fans will be here very often once they discover this little hole-in-the-wall.

I'll definitely be back!
author: Faye H.

description: We live really close to this restaurant and really enjoy having their lunch specials M-F. It's so cheap for awesome korean food. I usually get their bi bim ba and kim chee fried rice. So yummy :P  Lunch does get a lil crowded so get their early or expect a lil wait.  Their services are quick and very friendly. Their small dishes are pretty good and comes with rice in the tea that taste very good. I try to come here whenever we have a day off work. Cheers.!
author: Ernie P.

description:
Came for: nearby K-food to grub on in the neighborhood
Will come back for: satiating K-food craving, esp. bibimbap and bulgogi casserole (broiled lean cut beef in stone pot); either  take-out or casual sit-n-eat

My first visit was with a ~6 ppl group where we ordered everything from bibimbap to peach soju carafes as well as some bottles of Hite. 
Since then I have gone back for more visits and have also tried their soups.  Ever since I've had some bad K-food experiences, I think it's the soups that really speak to the true quality of a Korean restaurant.

So now, here goes:
- bibimbap -- they have 2-3 diff kinds all served in the stone pot (dol-sot), including one with calamari; very good
- bulgogi casserole -- a personal favorite and more please not many offer it, with broiled marinated thin strips of beef served over vermicelli noodles in stone pot (dol-sot, as mentioned above); seems healthy too; very good 
- pah jun -- the "pancake" thing; came out rather thick and hence mushy; meh, just ok
- soon doobu -- soft tofu in spicy soup; nothing spectacular, but good
- galbi tang -- miso-type based soup with beef pieces; the soup base tasted au natural but not quite hearty/thick; just ok
- yuk gae jang -- spicy soup with bean sprouts and beef; the soup didn't seem to be artificial seasoned but lacked any "umph"; a-ok
- banchan -- the "little dishes" are served in a sectioned off plate that reminded me of school meals; I've seen better, but they make up for it in service and generous refills

Overall, carries repeat value; more than anything for its consistency.  Glad it's nearby.  With it's late hours, it's also a better option as a late night eat.
author: Carol K.

description: This place has either changed owners or found a better cook.  The food here has been freakin awesome recently.  I use to live near here but I moved over a year ago.  The food was always just ok.  But its freakin good now.  The seafood pancake, cheese omelet, and dol sot bi bim bap is really good.  Its arguably one of the best I have eaten in the city.  This is some pretty bold words for a fatty.  If you haven't been in a while it is time to try it again.  This place is still smaller than my penis BTW.  Its pretty small.
author: Fatty A.

description: Anything with BBQ beef.  When I'm in San Francisco, I always make a point of hitting this place.  My favorite Korean place in the city.
author: Michael C.

description:
the BESTTTT korean food ive had in SF so far!! their food was delcious and so perfect!

i had their marinated short ribs...i am salvating again as i think about them...they were cooked to perfections and so juicy and not too tender...most places ive been to usually burn this but this was cooked and marinated soo well!

we also had their seafood bi bim bop which was soo delcious! it had plenty of seafood in it and they werent cheap about it either! 

and their soju...no other place makes their soju like this at all! we could barely taste the alcohol in it! it was a mixture of yogurt, peach, and soju...tasted like the yummy peach gummy candies that you eat!

i cant wait to go back there again
author: Annie L.

description:
my friends parked at the Safeway lot and got their cars tolled.  true, they overstayed their welcome by a few hours, but i still recommend finding street parking.  friends don't let friends get their cars tolled, especially since the fee is apparently mad expensive.

the side dishes are few and somewhat shady looking, and they put beans in their kimchi ramen stew, but the rest of their menu is tasty and consistent, no matter what crazy hour you decide to drop by.  there's usually always a wait though and the two seats they have by the door are never free.
author: Andrew P.

description: closest thing to a soju bang in sf......about $11 for one boo-deh-jji-geh (spicy soup with beans, spam, hotdog, noodles, kimchi, etc.), a small platter of banchan and rice feeds two grown men...use the rest of the money on soju or beers...and it's pretty cheap eats with a good cheap buzz.......the jji-geh and ttangs (soups) are good here....the grilled meats and stir-fried spicy dishes aren't bad either....now stop complaining....
author: Hen A.

description: This should really be 3 1/2 stars but I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt. I sat at the counter and asked the cook to give me the best thing they had. I got a delicious rice and beef thing in a big searing hot stone looking pot. If the place was a little cleaner it would have earned the full four stars from me.
author: Manny F.

description:
This isn't the best Korean I've had but it's decent and a good value. The place seems to have a bit of a Japanese influence on the menu. I had the grilled mackerel ($8.95). For my $8.95 I got:

- 1 standard miso-sized bowl of miso soup. it was your standard Japanese-resto miso-y miso soup. good enough

- unstrained barley tea

- an odd all-in-1 panchan plate containing
-- potato salad (not western chunky style, more like minced)
-- steamed egg white
-- fish cake strips
-- kimchee (of course)
-- tofu strip

- mackerel with a coupla slices of lemon sharing a plate with iceberg lettuce with whatever that pinkish dressing is called (see what I mean about the Japanese influence--not that there's anything wrong with that)

the mackerel was just slightly overcooked but flakey and tasted good with the lemon

I also tried their red bean shaved ice dessert. contains red beans and shaved ice (duh), vanilla ice cream, and fruit cocktail. a bit pricey for the size at $4.95 but fun and tasty to eat 

this would probably not be my first, second or even third choice visiting this neighborhood for a repeat visit, but if I worked in the neighborhood I would definitely eat here regularly
author: Charles B.

description: Arang has a great bento box that you can get for lunch.  I had the BBQ Beef box and my friend had the Short Ribs box and both were around 7 dollars for lunch (which ran until 4pm).  It came with salad, this potato side, noodle side, 2 potstickers, rice, and a good amount of meat.  Pretty good deal.  I dont think I will ever find LA grade Korean food up here, but this is not bad at all.
author: Bert N.

description: Going to Toyose spurned me to write this review about Arang.  I love this place.  I didn't realize HOW much I loved this place until I went to Toyose with their mediocre food and horrible service.  THIS is the spot to go to for some GOOD korean food/late night food at decent prices. My faves are the combo/bento boxes, rice cake/ramen dish (SO MUCH SPICIER than toyose) and  bi bam bap.  I guess I could try more stuff, but I'm so hooked on the rice cake/ramen stuff.  YUM.  Don't waste your time at Toyose.  Minus one star because when Arang gets busy, the wait can be long...and the waitresses may forget about you in their hustle and bustle (but not purposefully ignoring you like Toyose!)
author: Cheryl L.

description: After living in Korea for 2.5 years, this is, in my opinion, the only good Korean restaurant in SF. The food is pretty good and totally legit Korean. I only gave it four stars because I'm still on a search for a Korean place that makes me go, "Oh my god, this is sooo good!"
author: Molly Z.

description: Everything about this place is sub-par except 4 two aspects that make this a must if you have over a party of 6-- the korean techno pop (not sure if this is a genre, but sure does sound like it) and the vibe of everyone there being future AA members.  I don't know if i was just really pounded everytime i went there but everyone seemed to have liquid dripping from their tables like us.  The mirrors are a fun way to check out cute k-girls with their bfs while keeping the peace.  Great starting point b4 heading to Do Re Mi Music Box (Karaoke on Post).
author: omar b.

description:
I've been here several times~

2weeks ago, I went to Arang restaurant with my friends. 

we were 8members, and we ordered differnt menu each other. 

Then, We shared our food.  It was awesome!! 

I recomend jeyukbokkum(pork). bi-bim bap and ddokbbokki. 

However, If you don't like spicy food, you'd better order other things.

In addition,  you can order Soju that is a korean traditional alcohol
like vodka.

lastly, green teas and all of side dishes are free. 

If you live in San Francisco, you have to go there!!
author: Jiung K.

description: I've eaten here a couple of times and I think the food is alrite. I haven't eaten much Korean food so I cannot vouch for its authencity, but it's not bad. Service is pretty quick but the restaurant is kinda small, 3 booths on one half and a few tables on the other. This place is always bumping Kpop too, but I don't mind that. Maybe I'll go try Won Mi like the other reviewers suggested... It opens at 12 pm (or 11 am?) and closes at 2 am most days
author: Anthony C.

description: The first time I came here, I couldn't remember a thing because I was SO drunk, the only thing I remember was  running to the bathroom every 2 minutes.. But my friend told me it was really good, especially on a cold night. I like how they open really late. I came here with my co-worker around 1230 in the morning after a long night working in the kitchen and standing/running around the whole night. I was surprised that there were lots of people in here at that time. The only thing I didn't like is that they didn't give any small complementary dishes that Korean places usually give out. I got the Bi Bim Bop. It was a hefty portion. Lots of beef, they way I like it. For about $9? It was really affordable. I like the gum they give with your check.. you give some and receive some..
author: Juliane N.

description: I haven't been here in a while but my intentions for going to this place very rarely involved food and I always went late at night.  Back in the day (see, I'm old school), I used to go for peach soju.  Before I learned to really drink alcohol, I needed sweet, candy like drinks.  I also got my little sister plastered on accident on one occasion.  I am a bad unni.  However, I think this taught her not to drink too much when she started college and she's now almost a doctor so maybe it worked out for the best.  For the memories,  I give it a 4.
author: Seong P.

description: I was not too impressed with the food here. This restaurant is totally hidden in this strip mall,and the restaurant is actually really small. My bf has been coming to this place for years. I ordered the seafood bibimbop and I just didn't enjoy it so much. The rice never really got crispy, the way I like it. The seafood was okay, a little too overcooked for me. My bf likes to order the beef bibimbop, but like I said , for me it was okay. I do have to say though, the price of the food was very reasonable. The service was slow and there was just one other table that was being served. The restaurant was really warm and there was just no circulation going on in there. With the hot bowl and the spiciness of the dish, it was almost unbearable in there. Maybe that's why I couldn't enjoy the food. I would give this place another try, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.
author: carebear l.

description: A very decent 3 star place.  I really liked the spam & hot dog ramen spicy soup and the spicy chicken.  The prices are really cheap for Korean food and it's open really late.  The service does leave something to be desired, but it's not a place you'd expect super attentive service anyways.  The shrimp fried rice omelet is not as good as the picture would suggest.  It's ketchup fried rice basically and not very tasty at that.  The spicy pork was okay, but a few too many fatty pieces of pork and tons of sauce.  Overall though for price & quality I'll be back.
author: Joann C.

description:
cheap decent korean food.  for cheap.

enough said.  its not fancy.  it's a good place to come with your friends and eat.  and drink.  or either or both.  i personally like the stone pot bibimbap.  the kalbi is pretty decent.  the spicy pork is also good.  the chicken wings you could pass on, but aren't bad.  just aren't worth getting all the time (like the aforementioned items)

but you're really here for the food and drinks.  the atmosphere leave's something to be desired, but not bad, just run of the mill.
author: Jason J.

description:
i've only eaten here late nites and really the first time i ever tried korean food was here.  don't know if the soju helped with the flavors, but it was great.  i'm a huge fan of dok pokey...haha!  i know i butchered that one, but that's straight phonics!
the ABC at the end was pretty good as well (dessert icecream over noodles and shaved ice).  i think that's what its called. 
oh yeah, it's open late and pretty cheap.
author: Roy N.

description:
Yes, maybe I have to eat here. Just maybe. Could it be the dead souls...oh they keep calling me. Maybe the kimchi keeps calling me. Maybe my korean girlfriend keeps calling me on my phone and we keep going to this restaurant because it is so fucking good.
And eating korean with koreans is good. When you can order food in the language that everyone taking the orders is speaking is a plus. Have you ever ordered your fucking burritos in Spanish? Have you ever tried? Maybe your plate will be larger than normal, even if you spanglish the thing to the ground.
So my girlfriend orders in Hangul and I get everything with fire. Eating hot things to get the chilli taste out of your burning mouth is  lesson to be learned at this joint. They have some chewy rice rolls that come in satan sauce and man, just wash it down with pickled hot shit. 
"Lady, get me a mek joo! And turn the fucking K Pop down! I can't hear myself eat!"
author: Jeremiah M.

description:
the only thing that is decent here is the bi bim bap..
but as i have mentioned before..
you can't really screw that up.. even if you tried..

i've eaten here many times.. and the food is always unremarkable.. 
sometimes.. it's almost bad..

stay away from the omelette rice..
there was something else that i got that i REALLY disliked.. but i can't really remember it..
SEE??! unremarkable food.. i can't even remember what was in the dish i ordered..
author: monica c.

description: love their soju here!  food is pretty good as well and is open late.  potstickers, bibimbap, seafood soup, jap chae, sizzling spicy chicken and korean short ribs are delish!
author: Kae B.

description: This place is really cool.  It stays open pretty late, parking isn't too crazy and the food is awesome!  The only minor thing I don't like about it is the limited seating.  The only place i feel comfortable sitting is in the booth area.  My favorite things to eat here are: the beef bento box, spicy pork dish, and of course the staple of chicken terriyaki.  I also love what comes with the bento box: shredded potatoes and gyoza.  I love this place!!!
author: Marylouise R.

description:
i came in with relatively not-high expectations, and i was definitely not disappointed. we had the yukejang and pork bulgogi, and i thought both were pretty tasty. yukejang was semi-spicy, but i would have preferred a bit more heat. the bulgogi came in a nice sweet-but-not-overly-sweet sauce that seemed to have a bit more red pepper than normal; always a plus in my book. the panchan was nothing to write home about.

i know other reviewers have commented on the rude staff, but they were great in my opinion. even though it was pretty busy, they definitely responded quickly to requests for more water and rice.

price-wise, this is one of the more affordable korean restaurants i've been to in sf. especially considering the atmosphere is still pretty cute. we went on a saturday, but i hear it can be pretty empty other nights.
author: Monica C.

description:
decent korean fast food place...
they have a variety of dishes on their menu which are tasty, but nothing beats the food at restaurants in korea...
author: charlotte s.

description:
tasty food, friendly wait staff. it's a total hole-in-the-wall but that makes it fun. wish they brought me more kimchee tho =)
the lunch menu is cheaper but i haven't checked it out yet.
author: Natasha F.

description: Cheap simple way to satisfy a kimchee craving.  Staff is polite though forgetful (as in, forget that you are there).  I wasn't expecting much going in, I'm not a Korean food connoisseur and dinner only cost me $10, so overall this place isn't bad
author: M P.

description: Food is ok. Service is terrible. Very  slow and rude. Don't go there when you are hungry. It takes forever to have someone take your order. It takes another forever for them to cook. Bad experience! Two stars - one for the ok food, one for the music that they play in the restaurant.
author: alex e.

description:
i've been coming to arang for almost 8 years now and it's one of the best places i like to eat.  

no matter how hard crappy sucky stupid day at work, a meal here afterwards ALWAYS makes the whole day worth the struggle.

i like the short rib box (which comes with shredded potatoes, chapche glass noodles, 2 potstickers, rice, romaine/thousand island salad.  the meat for the most part is pretty well marbled (sometimes too much) but tender and juicy and sooooo flavorful.

the potstickers here are the best in town.  stuffed with delicately seasoned pork and veggies, the skins are just the right thinness, not too gummy/doughy, served with a nice soy/chili/green onion dipping sauce.

bi bim bap here is the bomb (rice, egg, veggies, beef or seafood or veggies served in a hot stone bowl), as is their accompanying bi bim bap sauce, sweet and spicy.

i also like the mussel soup and the stirfried squid over noodles (it's all sauteed in this red chili sauce and accented with zucchini and onions), great over rice.

and the dessert...  goodness only justifiable by actually having it live and in person.  (secret ingredient: ctc)

service can be slow since there's often only 1, sometimes 2 servers working the whole restaurant.  appetizer plate (kimchee, tofu, etc) is served only with the entrees, not the dinner boxes.

they play koit radio in the daytime and korean trance at night time!

portions are the same lunch and dinner, just different prices.

plus they're open til about 3am.
author: Kimby T.

description: The waitresses are really friendly and the food is good.  The Arang combination is a really good deal, but I usually just drink.  For the month of February all alcohol is 1/2 off!!!!  If you didn't go during February its ok, March all alcohol is 25% off.  Go while you can!!!
author: Mike S.

description:
----

I love this place.

The price is right, the food is good and there is a lot of it. I ate every bit of my meal. 

Lunch is an excellent value. Not likely I will go at night. 

Delicious!
author: Robert K.

description:
i have a tendency to order bibimbap every time i see it on a menu (even in mall food courts), so i've only ordered bibimbap at Arang, and it is good.  what else is good?  the lemon soju.  knock back a few because it tastes like kool-aid, and then before you know it, you're giggling like an idiot.  

the only complaint i have is that the service is a little slow.  the waitresses are super friendly and sweet, but they tend to get a little harried and forgetful.
author: Jolene T.

description: I really like the Dohl Soht BiBim Bap here (ya know, the mix of rice, meat and veggies in the stone pot.)  I like how it already has the red pepper paste mixed into it.  Spiced to perfection!
author: Sarah Z.

description: I like this place, it's open late which is the best thing. Seems like a lot of Korean places in SF are open late. Anyways they have really good tofu soup and the food comes out fast. The staff is really nice. I enjoy the food. Also you get a lot of food too. Sometimes too much, only sometimes. Try it when you're up late.
author: alfred k.

description:
yummy korean food at nice low costs, late at night... i wish there was a korean joint like this in phoenix...

i love their little all-in-one banchan plate. their kimchi is so good, too! and best of all, they serve you bori-cha! sighhhhh. yes. i like this place. plus, the waitress didn't give us dirty looks when we asked for more water/banchan, or when the 4 of us whipped out or DS's to continue our Tetris battle while we waited for our food... good times!
author: Aletheia W.

description: Delicious Korean eats at cheap prices with late-night hours! I love their soon dooboo, bulgogi, and bibimbap. Unfortunately, their wait staff can be pretty inattentive. One time after they sat my group, they entirely forgot to bring us place settings (none whatsoever) or any beverages. Other times, they've fail to check up on my table after bringing our food. The waitresses can be quite very rude. The restaurant itself is pretty small, so the wait for a table can be quite long. Give it a try. 3 stars.
author: Emily C.

description: They have the best Dol-sot Bibimbap and the best peach soju. The Kimchi soup was also tasty (very very spicy) and the tiny appetizer dishes as well. Been coming here for 6 years. There was a waitress who was always there the first few years that I've been eating there and she was very nice and helpful; but the last few times that I was there, I didn't see that nice waitress anymore and the service became lacking. Although the food pretty much makes up for it, ergo the 4 stars.
author: Jo C.

description: Yay! Quick service. Good tempura, udon, and teriyaki! A lot of food for not much money.
author: Josie A.

description: I've never had any problems with my Dolsot Bi Bim Bap (: It is still very delicious every time I go there . The staff is very friendly, however they need to learn how to pay more attention to their customers . Most of the time, I need to walk up to them & say, "Check, choo seh yo. (Check, please)." -__-" Their Arang Combo is probably the best deal if you want to get the bento boxes-- HELLA food . & if you want BETTER bento boxes (lunch boxes), go to a Japanese Restaurant .
author: Jenny Y.

description: If I lived nearby, I'd be eating out here regularly. The restaurant is comfortable and the food is well prepared, but nothing fancy though. If you're too lazy to cook and looking for a quality meal, this is a good place to go. Their hot tea is great, with a whole bunch of those popped rice things in it.
author: Tony L.

description: Usually when my homegirl and I are craving korean food, we'll come here. We know what to expect. Crowded cause the place is so small but the food is worth the wait. We always order the same thing, assorted meat variety kimchi chigae. Spicy kimchi broth with spam, hotdogs, kimchi, green onions, and ramen. Sounds weird? Don't knock it till you try it! If you want cheap korean food come here. They have OB beer here, yipee!!
author: Sharon Y.

description: Food: 2.5-3 stars. Serving "army jige" and Dol Sot at 1AM with K-Pop playing, oh...and easy parking in the Safeway parking lot gives it extra points with me. And generally pretty good service as well. Good as in friendly, not necessarily fast. But friendly makes up for a lot!
author: Johnny O.

description: Decent korean place. dont expect good service, dont expect extra bachan ? ( pardon my spelling ), dont expect the waitress remember to refill you tea/water. bottom line, dont expect me to come back here !
author: sherly A.

description: Whenever I come to Arang, I get happy! why you ask? Because I know I am going to leave full and drunk, and for half the price I would spend at a typical bar.  Couple bottles of soju and hite and some om rice or tofu or bibimbap or meat or friend chicken...PLUS! the anniversary month, all the alcohol is 50% off! man...this place is awsome...
author: Richard B.

description: I would like to give this place five stars for the simple fact that they stay open so late, but the fact that they only put one waitress on the floor knocks it down a few stars.  The poor girl was swamped and I think forgot about us at least three time.  The food is good and at a good price.  Unfortunately, not too many places are open that late in this area and this place is no secret to the young and hungry crowd!
author: Devon M.

description: I love this restaurant!! Most of their plates are GOOD and delicious.. plus it's CHEAP!  The only thing I hate is that it's a small restaurant and always crowded.
author: Joanna W.

description: I used to really hate this place....but then I discovered a ramen with spam, hot dogs and kimchee in a spicy broth.....delish.  On a cold day it really hits the spot.  The short rib soup is also very yummy for the non spicy lovers.  If you can fit in the kimchee fried rice go for it.
author: Allison T.

description: Awesome dol-sot bi-bim-bap. You kind of have to know what to order, but it's my go-to Korean place.
author: Lily K.

description: My friend took me to this place -- he said it was really good, not that spicy because I'm not too big on spicy food.  They should have a warning that the stew was filled with peppers - even when I asked the waitress if it was spicy, she said no it's not that spicy.  She offered water to put in, but it wasn't even heated.  She took too long refilling the tea, as well and it wasn't like the restaurant was packed.  Then I ordered something else, and I guess they were in a hurry, half of the beef wasn't even cooked.  The gyoza wasn't even fully boiled/cooked either, but when they pan fried it the other half side was burnt.  I don't recommend this place at all.  The waitress was slow and the food was bad...  I would never ever go there again if they paid me a million dollars.
author: Ro O.

description: I just keep coming back here. Perhaps because it's reliably low priced and because my friends can't seem to make up there minds when we're trying to find something open late in J/K-town. Food selection is great, though I never order the noodles (they're always instant). Stick with the lunch/dinner specials (which are the same just priced differently at diff times). =)
author: Jj H.

description:
I'm giving this place 5 stars based on pure history...10 years of drunken nights here history. The food is OK for the prices they charge, although it looks like they have changed things up a bit.

I'm still nostalgic for the olden days when it was like a scene outta "Cheers" where all the unnies know your name. LOL. 

Service quality has gone down but it's always good when the owner is there, she's the best!
author: April S.

description:
My bf and I often use the word "bi bim bap" as a playful way to insult each other, like "Stop being such a bi bim bap."  We say that only because it's fun to say, because we LOVE bi bim bap, especially from Arang!  The week we discovered it, we ate there 5 times in 2 weeks, and the waitresses even gave us free soda the last time we were there.  Arang is great when you want a quick Korean fix, especially when it's late at night and you don't feel like greasy diner food or horrific fast food.  Really reasonable prices!!!

Order the bi bim bap & the spicy pork plate - great combo to share for 2 people.  Even though I like to attack my food when it comes, make sure to let the rice of the bi bim bap sizzle, get crispy and delicious in the hot stone pot.  Just like the method to get great grill marks on a piece of meat, leave the rice alone!  Once you think the bottom has gotten crispy enough, mix in that spicy/sweet/bbq-esque sauce they give you.  I could probably funnel that sauce directly into my mouth because it's THAT good.  The crispy rice, the soft rice in the middle, the beef, and veggies (bean sprouts, spinach and mushrooms) and the sauce from heaven are a delicious combo.  The panchan are okay: tofu, bean cakes, kim chee, and my favorite pickled veggies (usually carrots and radishes).  If you finish a side, they are really nice and will give you more for free, which always happens to me because I only eat the kim chee and the pickled veggies.  One time, they randomly put potato salad in the panchan dish, and I thought I was at Hawaiian Drive-In and not Arang.  However, the service is always quick, and their servers are kind and attentive.

The music will make you go bonkers at times while simultaneously making you laugh or roll your eyes.  Their bathroom is one I would normally try to avoid.  The last time I was there it wasn't particularly clean, and there was a dirty mop in the corner.  Let's hope that the bi bim bap doesn't cause big messes!
author: Courtney B.

description: I had the BBQ pork plate and I finished the whole thing by myself! I thought it was really delicious. The kimchee was really refreshing. I will probably go here again if i'm ever in the neighborhood!
author: Ricialg P.

description:
mmmmmmmmmm..hungry just thinking about Arang!  i can't forget the good ol' days of late night runs to this joint back in the college days.  back when QUANTITY + low price meant absolutely everything.  if you're into authentic korean dishes and a ton of banchans (small side dishes), this really isn't the place for you..however, if you're like me and enjoy boonshik (appitizers), you really can't complain!  recently my cousin and i paid a visit to this place while contemplating on a place to eat late night after shopping and a movie in the city.  my cousin was from out of town so i suggested this place..and she loved it!  between the two of us, we had a dolsot bibimbap, ramen tukboki, soon dooboo chigae, and a peach soju..(we were really REALLY hungry =D)  all that food and we ended up paying under $40 after tips and all.  i think most of the dishes ran around $6~10.  

we were there past midnight on a friday night and the place was jam packed.  food was good and service wasn't too bad either..and this place has been around forever!  these things make it obvious why i love this joint and have me keep on coming back whenever i'm in the area..
author: Rosa K.

description:
They get one star because their dishes are half decent. 

They don't get rest of the four stars because they have the worst service .

A couple of years ago, I went there for my friend's birthday. After we paid, we were gathering in front of the restaurant to decide where to go afterwards. A few minutes later, one of the waitresses came out and demanded for more tips. We gave 10% because their service wasn't that stellar. We had to wait over an hour to be seated and they never once came by to our table after the food came out. 10% tips were more than generous. My friend ended up giving them extra tips because he didn't want to make a fuss about it and ruined our friend's birthday.

I never intended to go back there, but after circling around Geary for parking last week, my friends and I gave up on eating around Geary. We went to Arang again because they have the convenience of parking. This time, they didn't even ask us whether we wanted anything to drink. We had to specifically ask for tea. They brought a small cup of tea for each of us. However, once we requested for a refill, they completely ignored us. They refilled the tea for the tables in front of us and behind us, but did not come by to our table. On top of that, they brought out the wrong order, of which they refused to take back. 

Parking or no parking, we will never go back there ever again.
author: adrian y.

description: Where else at 3am in the morning can you you get spicy Korean food, listen to Korean techno pop and delicious miso soup all served by friendly waitstaff? I love the bi bim bap dish here as well as the teriyaki beef box. If you have late night cravings for Korean food Arang might be able to assist your hunger pangs.
author: Will C.

description: Arang is bomb...  I can't stop eating there, but should.  Soju, bogogi, taeji bogogi, kalbi, etc. make good things happen.  Yum yum.
author: Joseph M.

description: Pretty good Korean.  I had the kimchee chigae without the meat.  It was hot, spicy, and delicious (my mouth is watering just thinking about it).  I didn't really dig on the panchan, but it was cute served on a dish that reminded me of a school lunch cafeteria tray.  I tried my friend's seafood pancake which was really really good.  Good beer.  I tried the raspberry Korean wine, which was sticky sweet, but still good.  The servers were nice.
author: Sarah F.

description: I see few people comparing Arang to Toyose.  They are two completely different places.  Toyose is a place to get completely wasted.  Anyways, the food isn't too bad, plus the half off on alcohol is always good.  The only thing that just bothers me is sometimes the dishwasher doesn't do a very good job of washing the cups and bowls.  My tea still tastes like soap.  One funny story I do have though.  Came here with few friends one night and I saw baekuln saram call this place A-rang, like my phone rang.  heheh
author: A L.

description: If you like paying to be rushed through your dining experience, then just come here, right before they close, when the workers are dying to get the heck out of Dodge.  Rudeness takes this place way, way down.  This rudeness was experienced on 9/13/09 at 1:15 AM, just 45 minutes prior to closing.  Both one male & one female server both  rushed us to order and bussed our tables before we were finished eating.  Also, told us to make our own sauce for their seafood pancake.   I'd much rather give business to a place that isn't going to give you attitude..the food is OK and satisfies those late-night cravings for spicy food....Instead, just go to the barbeque place across the street...which is open just as late, has nearly similar menu items and won't rush your late-night dining experience.  I had been a regular customer for the past 8-9 years, but now will stop eating here, just because they're such JERKS!  If you're the owner of ARANG reading this, take note:  people in this economy aren't going to take your crap!
author: Lark A.

description: If you are craving korean food, this is the best place to go for some decent korean food.  Some of their items are very authentic and everything is decently priced especially their bento boxes.  This is also a great place to go for drinks before or after a night of fun.
author: Charles C.

description:
This place is great for that random late night Korean food craving everyone gets (esp. if you're Korean) since it's open until 2 am. 

Soju and other random liquor was on sale, so that was pretty exciting. 
And their meh oon tang is unexpectedly really tasty. They give you that extra "service" if you order lots of food/liquor--or if you have someone in your party who demands "quietly" that we should get some service since we ordered 2 jjigaes, 3 sojus, 1 large hite, and some binddae dduk. 

Definitely the place to go if you're looking for some 2-cha or 3-cha.
author: Esther L.

description: Parking, good food, clean restaurant, friendly service...what more could you ask for. This is a small place with big taste. its not a 5 star restaurant as far as dining goes, it doesn't have the ambiance for that. but it gets five stars anyway. I say F*** the ambiance, i want to walk out full, happy, and with good taste in my mouth. This place has that. with a reasonable price to boot..
author: Jonathan B.

description: i have  never been in here truth be told, but i checked in because i like it! they have KFC!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! KOREAN FRIED CHICKEN. thats my fave. it should be every chicken lovers fave. they have bento boxes of that sort but not a lot of sides. they have BOMB ASS GUM ! at the end! :] MELON KOREAN GUM, i went to kukje to look but they dont have it. their bul go gee isn't bul go gee... its some soup thing. so AT moved on, but i gotta try their bi bim bap! I liked it when AT got it for me from mama's in south city so i'll be back.
author: Carolyn Y.

description: People probably think i'm crazy for rating arang five stars but I literally spend 4 out of 7 days of the week in this restaurant getting piss drunk. I get the best customer service here and that's what keeps me coming back.  food is cheaply priced compared to other korean restaurants.  Oh yeah and they always hook it up there with either an omelette or gyoza!
author: Chrissy E.

description:
Not bad for a small Korean place.

I have been coming to this restaurant for about 8 years now.
