One you can really beat their prices on the menu. Their food is always consistent and I have never had bad service here. I love their bi bim bap,  dang ja chigae, and their dinner combos including lunch combos are a great deal. 

Cant really go wrong with this place if you are looking to spend less then $10 a person for a meal. Most Korean places you would spend at least $28 a head.
author: mel g.

description:
Let me start off by saying that Arang is what it is, a version of fast food that is Korean. Its kinda like my go to bar, I come in and get what I usually get and don't expect the place to knock me out of my seat. The food is consistant and lately the alcohol prices have dropped, which is always a good thing. 

The box lunch/dinner is my go to meal, but their specialties are pretty good when I'm with other people.  Parking is pretty easy with the Safeway parking lot, but the area can get shady after midnight. Plus this place stays open until 2 AM everyday. 

A great place to come and drink and snack on some food. The decor is poor and the seating arangment is kinda weird. Like im sitting in a large walk in closet. Service is ok, but something I wouldn't really expect from a place like this. I eat here to not be bothered by staff, not that I don't like that.
author: mark h.

description: I used to live in the area, and found Arang to be pretty reliable.  It's open late, prices are reasonable, and the food quality is better than most of the other Korean places on Fillmore.  It's not awesome, but pretty good.  We've ordered the bibimbap and spicy tofu soup plenty of times.  Last week when we went, we tried the pork bone and beef and potato soup for 2 to share, and it was yummy and hit the spot.  Only problem was we got really thirsty afterwards (makes me wonder too much msg?).  And the place is really small.  Once, we encountered a late noisy drunk group next to us that was annoying since we weren't in the mood for it and in that space we can hear everything.  It's probably unavoidable though, so we go if we think we won't be too bothered by it.  And it doesn't happen all the time.
author: Allison M.

description:
Food: Try the bibimbap! You'll get hooked onto it. Oh, and the soft tofu soup! Great stuff during cold weather. 
Bev: Lemon soju! 
Service: Most of the time, they only have 1or 2 people serving 8-10 tables. So, expect bad service (although the guy who works there was pretty nice the other night..). I wouldn't say rude though.
Ambiance: Expect loud, noisy patrons! ha! And hey, you can smell the BBQ smoke even from the nearby parking lot! Yummy yummy~
author: Jessica W.

description: The food and prices are good, however the experience is completely ruined due to the fact that the waiters/waitresses are so mind numbingly incompetent.
author: Jack Y.

description: I've been to this place many times and I think the food, albeit overpriced is good, not great, but decent.  However, I'm giving only 1 star because I was there a bit before closing......I say about 1:15 (I believe they close at 2) and the servers were already giving my friend and I attitude.  We order close to $60 worth of food but not once did they even acknowledge if anything was OK.  When we ask for more sauce for the "pancake", the rude waiter even said we can make it ourselves.....WOW, I wanna know how to do that.  They gave us a measly portion of condiment, not the plenty dishes that many other Korean restaurants offer, and even that, we had to ask for it.  Why just not say you're closed if you didn't want to serve us that night and I'd gladly go somewhere else.  If you want to eat here, just order out and skip the attitude and rudeness.  As for me, I know many many other more attitude-free Korean restaurants closer to my place at Irving and Geary and would take my business elsewhere where I'll get the appreciation of my dollars worth in this tough economic times.
author: Jerek L.

description: the seafood bi bim bop is the f-ing shit. the best deal is probably the combo plates. holler at your short ribs cause that stuff was sooooo good. i'm a little bias because i know the folks that own the place but the food really is great. =)
author: Linda N.

description: Ok I always try to boost Korean businesses.. but sorry Arang.. ur service sucks! So my girlfriends and I came here on a friday night.. there were 6 of us and instead of putting two tables of 4 together for us.. they seated 10 groups of 4 people before us! By the way these groups of 4 were all pushy Koreans.. I was the only Korean of my group so I'm sure the host/waiter didn't realize I knew what he was saying! =(  I had to complain and finally they seated us and when we asked for extra noodles, he said he wouldn't charge us for it.. but he didn't even give us extra noodles!! the food here is good.. but the service sucks.. unless ur a pushy Korean!
author: Esther Y.

description: bi bim bap, mmmm!
author: Aaron I.

description: let me start off by saying this - one of the best  korean restaurants ever! If you are looking for really authentic korean food then i probably wouldn't come here... i'd go a block down on fillmore where there are other korean restaurants that are more authentic. anyways, the prices aren't bad ... me and my friends come here when we're craving korean late at night or after we've finished going clubbing.. i love it because they usually open up until 2am! It's also good to come here during lunch because their prices are even cheaper! Whenever I come here i always order the bento box - the beef short rib, rice, chop che, 2 potstickers, vermacelli, pieces of potato... and i can't remember the rest.. the flavor of the beef was quite delicious and plus they give you a good amount of food. As i recall, the tempura wasn't up to my standards - maybe because it  isn't a japanese restaurant. it was kind of soggy. The bi bim bop was also good too! Let's see what else, the only downside about this place is that on weekends there can be a long wait because the place is small and service can be slow at times. I've never had a bad experience here... all i know is that this place is good for drinking alcohol with friends and eating your heart out to some good korean food! =)
author: leanna w.

description: what?! half off drinks?! i'm so there... hahaha... their dinner combo's are pretty good... apparently so is the bibimbap... the soup is yummie... cheap... filling... more than half way decent... half off beers? woohoo! sure the music playing is like freakshow on acid but your brain will ignore it soon enough...
author: Ed H.

description: when you're bored and hungry and just want to hang out with some friends to drink, laugh and eat. .. this is a good place.  they have really good soju.  their combo box is a good size and it comes with vermicelli, salad, gyoza, and potato.  it's simple korean food but definitely fills the tummy.  the servers are cool, lot's of parking, , opened late, and good music.
author: D W.

description: the side dishes are awful, but the kimchee fried rice is good and cheap. that's basically the one thing i keep coming back for.
author: ML N.

description: small but yummmy! short ribs and bi bam bap(?) awesome. cant wait to go back for some more! its right across from safeway so right after u can walk over for some dessert.
author: Rhonda H.

description: it's certainly not the best korean restaurant in town but for some reason, i love this place. i used to live right across the street and LOVED that it stayed open till late and it's great for take out. good place to drink soju/beer with decent korean food and it's reasonably priced. it's a tiny little place so you may not get seated, especially during weekends and at nights. so... not a place to necessary take your dates on, but a great place to hang out with friends for some casual and basic korean food.
author: Lucy C.

description:
ok so if any of your dinner attenpts at the Japan Town Center werent very pleasing then maybe you should try this place across the street in "Korea town?" my friends love coming here and its always a blast for us...maybe even a few tear drops of laughter...but thats only after we get our table

the food here is great even though my girlfriend and i usually get the same dish(it wouldnt be great if its usually packin with hungry ass mo-fo's like me no would it?) with a few exceptions of bbq pork or bbq beef and bi bim bap(?). two of my friends usually get the OB beer along with their dish so they really enjoy this place. the atmosphere is ok...according to my girlfriend she can tell that the music is pretty cheesy with the exception of a few illegible yet catchy songs lol but there always seems to be a familiar tone once in a while...just eat and dont mind the music it just helps for the background. as for parties, you should be ok with 4 but there IS a section of the restaurant thats usually used for parties for 6 or more...the only issue with that is yanno how big groups get...they could be done with their food yet theyre still laggin and killing time...not very courteous to the anxious group of people waiting in line...which is also another issue cuz this place isnt really all the BIG? and people do tend to just eat and talk to their hearts content but that goes for everyone...available staff is usually 2 or 3 which doesnt exactly help either

regardless...if you do manage to stay and wait for your table youre gonna enjoy this place...great food and good atmosphere though the wait time CAN throw you off but the good thing about it is that theyre open late so definitely id suggest a drop-by
author: Mark C.

description: Arang has become a popular late night hang out place of choice these past couple of months, especially with the half off liquor.  Meaning, large pitchers of soju are only $12.  First time I went here the waitresses checked ID by looking deep into your eyes.  They are that good and extremely friendly, reminding me of friendly parent's moms.  Food is above average, and its a top late night hangout spot.
author: Christopher Z.

description: place is not bad, its kinda like a korean fast food restaurant.  i like it, all the times ive been there its been cool, only thing is that when i do takeout orders sometimes, i come when they tell me to and its not ready!
author: Tony P.

description: Came here just today with my Korean friend .The ton-katsu was pretty good . It came with a side of rice , gyoza , salad , and noodles . The gyoza was alright . The salad was pretty good . It was lettuce with some kind of white dressing . I really liked the dressing . It was really watery but I like how it wasn't too salty & overpowering . The dressing had a light flavorful taste . The noodles w/ strips of potatoes were fantastic ! The strips potatoes were cut perfectly the right size and it went really well with the noodles .. very yummy . I tried some of my friend's chicken katsu it was pretty good too . My friend thinks I'm crazy but I could actually taste the difference between the chicken katsu & the ton katsu . The chicken in the chicken katsu tastes more thick while the pork in the ton katsu is not as thick and tastes more smooth . I ordered a dish of spicy rice cake which was alright but kind of too sweet . My friend agreed . It wasn't really that spicy either . Their dessert (they only have one) was good , but kind of dumb & a rip off . It was basically just a lot of shaved ice , some sweet milk , some Cinnamon Toast Crunch , red bean and pieces of fruits . I LOVE their homemade tea .. it's great . Idk what kind of tea it is but it has brown rice in it which I think is kind of cool . The service was very good too . The waitress kept refilling our teacups every time it was empty without us telling her to =) I will probably be back . I really recommend getting one of their box combo thingys .
author: Eileen L.

description: This place is a bit small--kind of blends in with the karaoke place next door.  Friendly service and reasonably priced food with a pretty extensive menu.  Oh, and there's plenty of parking!
author: deeks ..

description:
i'm a regular here and all i have to say is BI BIM BAP! they open late and not always crowded. their bentos unfortunateley suck! gyoza is pretty good! also, Do NOT get their TOFU SOUP! (go to tofu house for that). waiter is slow but very nice. (used to hook me up with BI BIM BAP until a bad experience with a friend. now i'm a full paying customer. 
in a nutshell:

FOOD: pretty decent, but go for bi bim bap
PRICE: average, but lunch is CHEAPP!
PEOPLE: who doesn't love young drunk people straight outtof a karaoke bar?
author: Rob C.

description: This place is great for korean bar food.  The person who neg'd the jigae with spam, hot dogs and ramen...that's what that dish is all about.  That is probably my favorite dish there!  For the spam and hot dog lovers out there this dish rocks!  Throw in the ramen and it's an instant comfort classic.  For those who want this to be a cleaner, nicer place like Won Mi, go to won mi or other restaurants up and down Geary.  Stick with the basic korean bar food and you'll be happy.  I had a plate of gizzards with the ramen jigae and it made my weekend.
author: Al L.

description: Mmm... good home-style Korean food with the "young hip" Korean atmostphere. Please do yourself a favor and don't ever ever ever go to the  Won Mi place on Fillmore. I don't know why people are recommending it, but I always eat at Arang cause it's the best thing in that area. Last time I ate at  Won Mi, it was strangely empty, hard to get the server's attention (as most Korean restaurants anyway), and the food wasn't as good (the kimchi especially was spoiled- seriously).
author: kuju w.

description: i usually get one of their bento boxes....either the bbq beef or the bbq ribs...they are really good.  have also tried their tofu soup and their bim bim bap, which are also very good.  have drank there a few times too...good soju...lots of parking and they are open on the late night.  they've been around since back in the day and i will keep on coming back!
author: Mich C.

description: haha. be warned, on the w/e, into the wee hours of the AM, it's a place where young asian thugs and their hooched out gf's hang out!  haha. that doesn't take away from the fact that the food is decent and a good place for late night eats. had the chicken wings- garlicky, spicy, sticky. oh so good! in the summer they have shaved ice with red bean... mmmm..
author: Eliza K.
